<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	the preceding 12 months
	(or for such shorter period that the registrant was required to submit and post
	such files). Yes&nbsp;

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="WINGDINGS" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	o

	mark if disclosure of delinquent filers pursuant to Rule&nbsp;405 of Regulation
	S-K is not contained herein, and will not be contained, to the best of
	registrant&#146;s knowledge, in definitive proxy or information statements
	incorporated by reference in Part&nbsp;III of this Form&nbsp;10-K or any
	amendment to this Form&nbsp;10-K.&#160;&#160;

<TD WIDTH="12%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:12.66%;">

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:3.16%;">

<A NAME="eolPage3"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A09-35889_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Item
	1.
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.5PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	BUSINESS
</FONT>
</B>
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_ITEM1_BUSINESS_161510">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<H4 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(a)&nbsp;General
	Development of the Business
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</H4>
<H4 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</I>
</H4>
<EFX_BUSINESS_STOCK_REPORT>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS_STOCK_REPORT"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Canterbury Park Holding
	Corporation (the &#147;Company&#148;) conducts pari-mutuel wagering operations and hosts &#147;unbanked&#148;
	card games at its Canterbury Park Racetrack and card room facility (the &#147;Racetrack&#148;)
	in Shakopee, Minnesota.&#160; The Company&#146;s
	pari-mutuel wagering operations include both wagering on thoroughbred and
	quarter horse races during live meets at the Racetrack and year-round wagering
	on races held at out-of-state racetracks that are televised simultaneously at
	the Racetrack (&#147;simulcasting&#148;).&#160; Unbanked
	card games, in which patrons compete against each other, are hosted in the card
	room at the Racetrack.&#160; The Company also
	derives revenues from related services and activities, such as concessions,
	parking, advertising, admissions, programs, a recreational vehicle park and
	from other entertainment events held at the Racetrack.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Company was incorporated under the laws of Minnesota on March&nbsp;24, 1994,
	acquired the Racetrack on March&nbsp;29, 1994, commenced seven day a week
	simulcast operations on May&nbsp;6, 1994, and, beginning in May&nbsp;1995,
	launched live horse racing and related pari-mutuel wagering on a seasonal
	basis, generally from early May&nbsp;to early September.&#160; The Company opened the card room on April&nbsp;19,
	2000 with 43 tables and expanded to 50 tables (the maximum permitted by law) in
	2001.&#160; The ownership and operation of the
	Racetrack and the card room are significantly regulated by the Minnesota Racing
	Commission (the &#147;MRC&#148;).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Company maintains a website at www.canterburypark.com.&#160; Our annual reports on Form&nbsp;10-K, our
	quarterly reports on Form&nbsp;10-Q and our periodic reports on Form&nbsp;8-K
	(and any amendments to these reports) are available free of charge on our
	website.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(b)&nbsp;Financial Information About Segments
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Company divides its business into three segments: horse racing, card room and
	concessions.&#160; The horse racing segment
	represents operations related to pari-mutuel wagering on simulcast and live
	horse races.&#160; The card room segment
	represents operations of the card room, and the concessions segment represents
	food and beverage services for simulcast and live racing, the card room and
	during special events.&#160; Further
	information regarding the Company&#146;s business segments is set forth in Note 12
	of the Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements under Item 8 of this Form&nbsp;10-K,
	and such information is incorporated herein by reference.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(c)&nbsp;Narrative Description of Business
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .75IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.75IN;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(i)
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.5PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Horse Racing Operations
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .75IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.75IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company&#146;s horse
	racing operations consist of year-round pari-mutuel wagering on simulcast horse
	races (&#147;simulcasting&#148;) and live thoroughbred and quarter horse races (&#147;live
	meets&#148;) held on a seasonal basis beginning in May&nbsp;and generally concluding
	in August&nbsp;or September.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Live
	Racing.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In 2009, the Racetrack
	hosted 62 days of live racing beginning May&nbsp;15th and concluding August&nbsp;30th.&#160; The meet included 42 days of mixed
	thoroughbred and quarter horse racing and 20
<B>
</B>
	days
	of thoroughbred only racing.&#160; The 2008
	live meet was 67 days long, beginning May&nbsp;3rd and ending September&nbsp;1st,
	and consisted of 43 days of mixed thoroughbred and quarter horse racing and 24
	days of thoroughbred only racing.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_BUSINESS_STOCK_REPORT>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Currently, Minnesota law
	requires the Company to schedule a minimum of 125 days of live racing annually,
	unless the Minnesota Horsemen&#146;s Benevolent and Protective Association (the &#147;MHBPA&#148;)
	agrees to a lesser number of live racing days.&#160;
	Since 1995, the MHBPA has agreed to waive the 125-day requirement and
	has allowed the Company to run a live meet of at least 50 days each year.&#160; After 2010, no assurance can be given that
	the MHBPA will agree to a shorter live meet than the 125-day statutory
	minimum.&#160; If the MHBPA does not agree to
	a live meet shorter than 125 days, the Company&#146;s operations could be adversely
	impacted by a
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	3
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_PB_3_153234_5335">
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="#010101" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='3',FILE='C:\JMS\MSOUNDA\09-35889-1\TASK4021382\35889-1-BA.HTM',USER='105074',CD='MAR 30 21:20 2010' -->
<A NAME="eolPage4"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A09-35889_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	decrease in the daily
	purses, potential reduction in quality of horses, lower attendance, lower
	overall handle and increased operating expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Simulcasting.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Simulcasting is the
	process by which live horse races held at one facility (the &#147;host track&#148;) are
	transmitted simultaneously to other locations that allow patrons at each
	receiving location (the &#147;guest track&#148;) to place wagers on races transmitted
	from the host track.&#160; Monies are collected
	at the guest track and the information with respect to the total amount wagered
	is electronically transmitted to the host track.&#160; All of the amounts wagered at guest tracks
	are combined into the appropriate pools at the host track with the final odds
	and payouts based upon all the monies in the respective pools.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company offers &#147;full
	card&#148; simulcast racing (broadcasting of another racetrack&#146;s entire daily live
	racing program) from up to 20 racetracks per day, seven days a week, 363 days
	per year, including Churchill Downs, Hollywood Park, Santa Anita, Gulfstream
	Park, Belmont Park and Saratoga Racecourse.&#160;
	In addition, races of national interest, such as the Kentucky Derby, the
	Preakness Stakes, the Belmont Stakes, and the Breeders&#146; Cup, supplement the
	regular simulcast program.&#160; The Company
	regularly evaluates its agreements with other racetracks in order to offer the
	most popular simulcast signals of live horse racing that are feasible.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Under applicable
	provisions of federal and state law, in order to conduct simulcast operations
	either as a host or guest track, the Company must obtain the consent of the
	state&#146;s regulatory authority and the organization which represents a majority
	of the owners and trainers of the horses who race at the Racetrack.&#160; In Minnesota, such consent must be obtained
	from the MRC and the MHBPA.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(ii)
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.5PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Card Room&nbsp;Operations
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The card room is open 24
	hours per day, seven days per week, offering two variations of unbanked card
	games: poker and table games.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Poker games, including Texas
	Hold &#145;Em, 7-Card Stud and Omaha, with betting limits ranging between $2 and
	$60, are currently offered in the poker room.&#160;
	A dealer, employed by the Company, regulates the play of the game at
	each table and deals the cards but does not participate in play.&#160; In poker games, the Company is allowed to
	deduct a percentage from the accumulated wagers and impose other charges for
	hosting the activity but does not have an interest in the outcome of a game.&#160; The Company may add additional prizes, awards
	or money to any game for promotional purposes.&#160;
	The Company collects a &#147;rake&#148; of 5-10%, depending on the limit of the
	game, of each addition to the &#147;pot&#148; up to a maximum of $5.00 per hand as its
	collection revenue.&#160; In addition, poker
	games offer progressive jackpots for most games.&#160; In order to fund the jackpot pool, the dealer
	withholds $1.00 from each final pot in excess of the $15 minimum.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Table games, including
	Blackjack, Fortune Pai Gow, Let-It-Ride, Three and Four Card Poker, Ultimate
	Texas Hold &#145;Em, and EZ Baccarat are currently offered in the card room.&#160; The Company&#146;s table games are required by law
	to be &#147;unbanked.&#148;&#160; &#147;Unbanked&#148; refers to a
	wagering system or game where wagers lost or won in card games are accumulated
	into a player pool liability for purposes of enhancing the total amount paid
	back to winning players.&#160; The Company may
	only serve as custodian of the player pool, may not have an active interest in
	any card game and does not recognize amounts that dealers &#147;win&#148; or &#147;lose&#148;
	during the course of play as revenue.&#160;
	The primary source of card room revenue is a percentage of the wagers
	received from the players as compensation for providing the card room facility
	and services, referred to as &#147;collection revenue&#148;.&#160; In addition, several table games offer a
	progressive jackpot.&#160; The player has the
	option of playing the jackpot and has the opportunity to win some or all of the
	jackpot amount, depending upon their hand.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(iii)
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.5PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Special Events
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	While pari-mutuel horse
	racing and card room operations are the Company&#146;s principal businesses, the
	Company&#146;s facilities are capable of being used for multiple purposes.&#160; In an effort to more fully utilize the
	property and to generate additional revenues, the Company has increasingly used
	its grandstand, grounds and parking lot for special events and rentals.&#160; While the use of the Company&#146;s facilities for
	particular special events
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	4
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_PB_4_153338_5796">
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="#010101" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='4',FILE='C:\JMS\MSOUNDA\09-35889-1\TASK4021382\35889-1-BA.HTM',USER='105074',CD='MAR 30 21:20 2010' -->
<A NAME="eolPage5"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A09-35889_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	and purposes varies from
	year to year, the following are among the types of events and purposes for
	which the Company&#146;s facilities have been used: snowmobile races, major arts and
	crafts shows, trade shows, concerts, fundraisers, automobile shows and competitions,
	vehicle and boat storage and private parties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(iv)
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.5PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Sources of Revenue
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	General.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company&#146;s revenues
	are principally derived from card room operations, wagering on live and
	simulcast horse races and concession sales.&#160;
	For the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, revenues from card
	room operations represented 50.6% of total revenues, wagering on horse races
	generated 28.6% of total revenues and concessions revenue represented 13.2% of
	total revenues.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Card Room&nbsp;Operations.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Company receives revenue from its card room, which operates 24 hours per day,
	seven days per week.&#160; The Company
	currently receives collection revenue from poker and table games tables.&#160; Under Minnesota law, the Company is required
	to pay 10% of the first $6 million of gross card room revenues towards purses
	for live horse racing at the Racetrack.&#160;
	After meeting the $6 million threshold, the Company must pay 14% of
	gross card room revenues as purse monies.&#160;
	Of funds allocated for purses, the Company pays 10% of the purse monies
	to the State of Minnesota Breeders&#146; Fund.&#160;
	The remaining 90% of purse monies are divided between thoroughbred
	(90%), quarter horse (9%) and standardbred (1%) purse funds.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Pari-mutuel wagering &#151; General.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In pari-mutuel wagering,
	bettors wager against each other in a pool, rather than against the operator of
	the facility or with preset odds.&#160; From
	the total amount wagered (&#147;handle&#148;), the Minnesota Pari-Mutuel Horse Racing Act
	(the &#147;Racing Act&#148;) specifies the maximum percentage, referred to as the &#147;takeout,&#148;
	which may be withheld by the Racetrack, with the balance returned to the
	winning bettors.&#160; The takeout constitutes
	one of the Racetrack&#146;s primary sources of operating revenue.&#160; From the takeout, funds are set aside for
	purses and paid to the State of Minnesota for pari-mutuel taxes and the
	Minnesota Breeders&#146; Fund (the &#147;MBF&#148;), which is a fund apportioned by the MRC
	among various purposes related to Minnesota&#146;s horse breeding and horse racing
	industries.&#160; The balance of the takeout
	remaining after these deductions is commonly referred to as the &#147;retainage.&#148;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The various forms of
	pari-mutuel wagering can be divided into two categories: straight wagering
	pools and multiple wagering pools, which are also referred to as &#147;exotic&#148;
	wagering pools.&#160; Examples of straight
	wagers include: &#147;win&#148; (a wager on one specific horse to finish first); &#147;place&#148;
	(a wager on one specific horse to finish first or second); and &#147;show&#148; (a wager
	on one specific horse to finish first, second or third).&#160; Examples of exotic wagers include: &#147;daily
	double&#148; (a wager in which the bettor selects the horses that will win two
	consecutive races); &#147;exacta&#148; (a wager in which the bettor selects the horses
	that will finish first and second in a race, in order); &#147;trifecta&#148; (a wager in
	which the bettor selects the horses that will finish first, second and third in
	a race, in order); and &#147;pick six&#148; (a wager in which the bettor selects the
	horses that will finish first in six consecutive races).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The amount of takeout
	earned by the Company depends on where the race is run and the form of wager
	(straight or exotic).&#160; Net revenues from
	pari-mutuel wagering on live races run at the Racetrack consist of the total
	amount wagered, less the amounts paid (i)&nbsp;to winning patrons, (ii)&nbsp;for
	purses, (iii)&nbsp;to the MBF and (iv)&nbsp;for pari-mutuel taxes to the State
	of Minnesota.&#160; Net revenues from
	pari-mutuel wagering on races being run at out-of-state racetracks and
	simulcast to the Racetrack have similar expenses but also include a host fee payment
	to the host track.&#160; The host fee, which
	is calculated as a percentage of monies wagered (generally 2.50% to 4.50%), is
	negotiated with the host track and must comply with state laws governing the
	host track.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Wagering
	on Live Races.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Racing Act
	establishes the maximum takeout that may be deducted from the handle.&#160; The takeout percentage on live races depends
	on the type of wager.&#160; The total maximum
	takeouts are 17% from straight
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	5
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_PB_5_153450_2897">
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="#010101" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='5',FILE='C:\JMS\MSOUNDA\09-35889-1\TASK4021382\35889-1-BA.HTM',USER='105074',CD='MAR 30 21:20 2010' -->
<A NAME="eolPage6"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A09-35889_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	wagering pools and 23%
	from exotic wagering pools.&#160; From this
	takeout, Minnesota law requires deductions for purses, pari-mutuel taxes and
	the MBF.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	While the Racing Act
	provides that a minimum of 8.4% of the live racing handle is to be paid as
	purses to the owners of the horses, the size of the purse is subject to further
	agreement with the horsepersons&#146; associations.&#160;
	The MBF receives 1% of the handle.&#160;
	The pari-mutuel tax applicable to wagering on all simulcast and live
	races is 6% of takeout in excess of $12 million during the twelve-month period
	beginning July&nbsp;1 and ending the following June&nbsp;30.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The following table sets
	forth the percentage distribution of each dollar wagered on live races at the
	Racetrack, as established by the Racing Act, and the Racetrack&#146;s retainage for
	the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 and 2008:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

	Live Racing
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:1.42%;">

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="41%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:41.0%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:2.5%;">
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="26%" COLSPAN="3" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID WINDOWTEXT 1.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:26.5%;">
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Straight
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:2.5%;">
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="26%" COLSPAN="3" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID WINDOWTEXT 1.0PT;BORDER-LEFT:NONE;BORDER-RIGHT:NONE;BORDER-TOP:SOLID WINDOWTEXT 1.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:26.08%;">
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Exotic
</FONT>
</B>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="1" WIDTH="25%" NOSHADE COLOR="BLACK" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(1)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.5PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Minnesota law provides that the 8.40% purse payment is
	a minimum.&#160; The actual percentage, if
	any, above the minimum is determined between the Racetrack and the MHBPA.&#160; Any additional amounts paid for purses
	decrease the Racetrack&#146;s retainage.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(2)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.5PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The current pari-mutuel tax structure exempts the first
	$12 million of takeout during a statutorily mandated twelve-month period.&#160; The total pari-mutuel tax liability for a
	twelve-month period will depend upon the total takeout during that period.&#160; There was no pari-mutuel tax liability in
	2009 and therefore, it is not factored into the above table.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Wagering
	on Simulcast Races.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The amount of takeout
	from simulcast wagering is determined by the laws of the state in which the
	host track is located.&#160; In addition, the
	Racing Act establishes a minimum that must be set aside from simulcasting for
	purse payments on racing within Minnesota.&#160;
	Different amounts are deducted for purses from the takeout depending on
	whether simulcasting occurs during the &#147;Racing Season,&#148; a statutorily defined
	25-week period beginning in early May&nbsp;each year, or outside of the Racing
	Season.&#160; If simulcasting occurs during
	the Racing Season, the amount set aside for purses further depends on whether
	the simulcasting is part of a full racing card that occurs during the part of
	the day that live races are conducted at the Racetrack.&#160; For races that are part of a full simulcast
	racing card that takes place within the time of live races at the Racetrack,
	the amount reserved for purse payout is 8.4%.&#160;
	For simulcasting conducted during the Racing Season that does not occur
	within the time period of live races, the purse is equal to 50% of the takeout
	remaining after deductions for pari-mutuel taxes, payments to the MBF and
	payments to the host racetrack for host track fees.&#160; For simulcasting conducted outside of the
	Racing Season, the amount that must be contributed to the purses is 25% of the
	takeout after deducting pari-mutuel taxes, payments to the MBF and host fee
	payments to the host racetrack.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	6
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_PB_6_154704_3020">
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="#010101" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
</DIV>

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

	following table sets forth the approximate percentage distribution of each
	dollar wagered for races simulcast at the Racetrack and the Racetrack&#146;s
	retainage for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 and 2008:
</FONT>

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="10%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;BORDER:NONE;BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE WINDOWTEXT 2.25PT;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:10.0%;">
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	100.00
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;PADDING:0IN 0IN 2.25PT 0IN;WIDTH:1.5%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	%
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="1" WIDTH="25%" NOSHADE COLOR="BLACK" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(1)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.5PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	This amount will depend upon the takeout at the host
	racetrack. This percentage is determined by local and state law applicable to
	the host track and ranges from 75.0% to 85.0%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(2)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.5PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The current pari-mutuel tax structure exempts the
	first $12 million of takeout during a statutorily mandated twelve-month
	period.&#160; The total pari-mutuel tax
	liability for a twelve-month period will depend upon the total takeout during
	that period.&#160; There was no pari-mutuel
	tax liability in 2009 and therefore, it is not factored into the above graph.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(3)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.5PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Although Minnesota law specifies purse percentages,
	the actual percentage is determined by agreement between the Racetrack and the
	MHBPA.&#160; For the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2008, the MHBPA allowed a 1.3% expense deduction, and in 2009, the expense
	deduction allowed was 1.6%.&#160; No expense
	deduction is expected for 2010.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(4)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.5PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Payments to the host track generally range from 3.0%
	to 4.5% of total handle, subject to negotiation with each host track.&#160; For purposes of this table, the host track
	fee is assumed to be 3.8%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<H5 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Concessions
	Revenue.
</FONT>
</I>
</H5>
<H5 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</I>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company earns revenue
	from food and beverage sales in its restaurant, group catering areas and
	numerous concession stands located throughout the facility.&#160; Food and beverage sales are offered during
	live and simulcast racing in the card room and during special events.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<H5 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Other
	Revenue.
</FONT>
</I>
</H5>
<H5 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</I>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company generates
	cash revenues from the receipt of admission and reserved seating charges,
	preferred and valet parking and the sales of various daily pari-mutuel
	publications.&#160; Additional revenues are
	derived from the operation of an RV Park during the summer months and the use
	of the Racetrack facilities year-round for special events such as concerts,
	trade and craft shows, snowmobile racing, business meetings, private parties,
	horse expositions and sales, boat and automobile storage and community
	events.&#160; The Company also generates
	revenue from providing advertising signage space, similar to that appearing at
	many sports stadiums, and leasing excess parking lot space for various
	automotive activities and vehicle storage.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(v)
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.5PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Competition
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	From 1994 through 2004,
	the Company was the only racetrack licensed to operate in the State of Minnesota.&#160; In January&nbsp;2005, the MRC granted a
	license to the North Metro Harness Initiative, LLC (&#147;NMHI&#148;) to construct and
	operate a harness racetrack in Columbus Township, Anoka County, MN.&#160; Columbus Township is approximately 50 miles
	from Canterbury Park. &#160;This license
	authorized NMHI to engage in pari-mutuel wagering on live and simulcast racing
	for standardbred (harness) horses.&#160; NMHI
	commenced operations as Running Aces Harness Park (&#147;Running Aces&#148;) in April&nbsp;2008.&#160; In addition, on completing a 50-day live meet
	as required by Minnesota law, the MRC granted Running Aces a license to operate
	a card room, and Running Aces began card room operations in competition with
	the Company in June&nbsp;2008.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	7
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_PB_7_155318_7748">
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="#010101" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='7',FILE='C:\JMS\MSOUNDA\09-35889-1\TASK4021382\35889-1-BA.HTM',USER='105074',CD='MAR 30 21:20 2010' -->
<A NAME="eolPage8"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A09-35889_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company also competes
	with other forms of gaming, principally casino-style gambling including slots,
	table games, and poker offered at numerous tribal casinos located throughout
	the State of Minnesota.&#160; In particular,
	the largest casino in Minnesota is located approximately four miles from the
	Racetrack.&#160; More recently, unbanked card
	games have also become available at some tribal casinos.&#160; The Company also faces increasing competition
	from offshore and out-of-state simulcast operations offering Internet and
	telephone account home wagering systems to Minnesota residents, although
	Minnesota regulatory authorities consider such wagering to be illegal.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company further
	competes with other forms of entertainment in the Minneapolis-Saint Paul
	metropolitan area, including a wide range of live and televised professional
	and collegiate sporting events.&#160; In
	addition, live horse racing competes with a wide variety of summer attractions,
	including amusements parks, sporting events and other local activities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company competes with
	racetracks located throughout the United States in securing horses to run at
	the Racetrack.&#160; Attracting owners and
	trainers is largely dependent on the ability to offer large purses.&#160; The Company experiences significant
	competition for horses from racetracks located near Des Moines, Iowa and
	Chicago, Illinois, both of which offer substantially larger purses than the Company.&#160; This competition is expected to continue for
	the foreseeable future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(vi)
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.5PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Regulation
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	General.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The ownership and
	operation of the Racetrack in Minnesota is subject to significant regulation by
	the MRC under the Racing Act and the rules&nbsp;adopted by the MRC.&#160; The Racing Act governs the allocation of each
	wagering pool to winning bettors, the Racetrack, purses, pari-mutuel taxes and
	the MBF and empowers the MRC to license and regulate substantially all aspects
	of horse racing in the State.&#160; The MRC,
	among other things, grants operating licenses to racetracks after an
	application process and public hearings, licenses all employees of a racetrack,
	jockeys, trainers, veterinarians and other participants, regulates the transfer
	of ownership interests in licenses, allocates live race days and simulcast-only
	race days, approves race programs, regulates the conduct of races, sets
	specifications for the racing ovals, animal facilities, employee quarters and
	public areas of racetracks, regulates the types of wagers on horse races, and
	approves significant contractual arrangements with racetracks, including
	management agreements, simulcast arrangements, totalizator contracts and
	concessionaire agreements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	A federal statute, the
	Interstate Horse Racing Act of 1978, also provides that a racetrack must obtain
	the consent of the group representing the horsepersons (owners and trainers)
	racing the breed of horses that race a majority of the time at the racetrack,
	and the consent of the state agency regulating the racetrack, in order to
	transmit simulcast signals of its live races or to receive and use simulcast
	signals from other racetracks.&#160; The
	Company has obtained the consent of the MHBPA and MRC for receiving and sending
	simulcast signals.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Issuance
	of Class&nbsp;A and Class&nbsp;B Licenses to the Company.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company holds a Class&nbsp;A
	License, issued by the MRC, which allows the Company to own and operate the
	Racetrack.&#160; The Class&nbsp;A License is
	effective until revoked, suspended by the MRC or relinquished by the
	licensee.&#160; Currently, the fee for a Class&nbsp;A
	License is $253,000 per fiscal year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company also holds a Class&nbsp;B
	License, issued by the MRC, that allows the Company to sponsor and manage horse
	racing on which pari-mutuel wagering is conducted at its Class&nbsp;A licensed
	racetrack and on other horse races run at out-of-state locations as authorized
	by the MRC.&#160; The Class&nbsp;B License is
	renewable each year by the MRC after a public hearing (if required by the
	MRC).&#160; Currently, the fee for the Class&nbsp;B
	License is $500 for each assigned race day on which live racing is actually
	conducted and $100 for each day on which simulcasting is authorized and
	actually takes place.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	8
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_PB_8_155415_141">
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="#010101" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage9"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A09-35889_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Limitation
	on the Number of Class&nbsp;A and Class&nbsp;B Licenses.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Pursuant to the Racing
	Act, so long as the Racetrack maintains its Class&nbsp;A License, no other Class&nbsp;A
	License may be issued to operate a racetrack in the seven-county metropolitan
	area (the counties of Hennepin, Ramsey, Washington, Scott, Dakota, Anoka and
	Carver), except the MRC may issue an additional Class&nbsp;A License within the
	seven-county metropolitan area, provided that the additional license may only
	be issued for a facility which, among other conditions, is located more than 20
	miles from the Racetrack, contains a track no larger than five-eighths of a
	mile in circumference, and is used exclusively for standardbred (harness)
	racing.&#160; An additional Class&nbsp;A
	license was issued to Running Aces on January&nbsp;20, 2005 (see &#147;Competition&#148;
	above).&#160; However, as long as the Company
	holds its Class&nbsp;A License, only the Company may own and operate a
	racetrack in the seven county metropolitan area where thoroughbred horses and
	quarter horses may be raced.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Limitation
	on Ownership and Management of an Entity, which holds a Class&nbsp;A License
	and/or Class&nbsp;B License.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Racing Act requires
	prior MRC approval of all officers, directors, 5% shareholders or other persons
	having a present or future direct or indirect financial or management interest
	in any person applying for a Class&nbsp;A and Class&nbsp;B license, and if a
	change of ownership of more than 5% of the licensee&#146;s shares is made after an
	application is filed or the license issued, the applicant or licensee must
	notify the MRC of the changes within five days of this occurrence and provide
	the information required by the Racing Act.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Card Room&nbsp;Regulation.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	MRC is also authorized by law to regulate card room operations, and the law
	requires that the Company reimburse the MRC for its actual costs, including
	personnel costs, of regulating the card room.&#160;
	For fiscal years ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, and 2008, the Company
	paid $150,000 and $116,000, respectively, to the MRC as reimbursement for costs
	of regulating card room operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	MRC issued an additional Class&nbsp;B License to the Company on January&nbsp;19,
	2000 that authorizes the Company to host unbanked card games.&#160; The Class&nbsp;B License is renewable each
	year by the MRC after a public hearing (if required by the MRC).&#160; Currently, the Class&nbsp;B License Fee of
	$10,000 per calendar year is included in the Class&nbsp;A License Fee of
	$253,000 per calendar year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Local
	Regulation.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company&#146;s operations
	are subject to state and local laws, regulations, ordinances and other
	provisions affecting zoning, public health and other matters which may have the
	effect of restricting the uses to which the Company&#146;s land and other assets may
	be used.&#160; Also, any development of the
	Racetrack site is, among other things, subject to applicable zoning ordinances
	and requires approval by the City of Shakopee and other authorities, and there
	can be no assurance such approvals would be obtained if any development was
	undertaken.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(vii)
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.5PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Legislation
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	As discussed in our
	previous filings with the SEC, the Company has supported over the past several
	years, and is currently supporting in the 2010 session of the Minnesota
	Legislature, legislation that would authorize slot machines and other games at
	the Racetrack (referred to as a &#147;Racino&#148;).&#160;
	Based on the success of several Racinos in other states, we continue to
	believe that if a Racino was authorized at the Racetrack on similar terms to
	legislation approved in other states, it would enhance horse racing with
	increased purses, provide growth and development opportunities for the Company,
	and provide significant new tax revenues for state and local governments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	effort to obtain legislative authority for initiatives favorable to the Company
	has required, and will continue to require, substantial expenditures.&#160;&#160; Due to the inherent uncertainty of the
	outcome of legislative activities, there can be no assurance that any bills
	favorable to the Company&#146;s interests will be enacted into law, and it is
	possible bills adverse to the Company could be enacted.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	9
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_PB_9_155523_7608">
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="#010101" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='9',FILE='C:\JMS\MSOUNDA\09-35889-1\TASK4021382\35889-1-BA.HTM',USER='105074',CD='MAR 30 21:20 2010' -->
<A NAME="eolPage10"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A09-35889_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(viii)
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.5PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Marketing
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company&#146;s primary
	market is the seven-county Minneapolis-Saint Paul metropolitan area plus the
	two counties to the south of the Racetrack.&#160;
	Current demographic information indicates that approximately 2.2 million
	adults age 18 and older reside within the primary market.&#160; The City of Shakopee, located in the
	southwestern portion of the metropolitan area, is one of the fastest growing
	communities in the region, and Scott County is one of the fastest growing
	counties in the country.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	To support its
	pari-mutuel horse racing and card room businesses, the Company conducts
	year-round marketing efforts to maintain the loyalty of live racing and
	simulcast patrons and attract new racing and card room customers.&#160; The Company utilizes newspapers and
	television advertising, the Internet, other print media, radio and direct mail.&#160; Often, the Company combines its marketing efforts
	to communicate the excitement of both wagering on horse racing and card
	playing.&#160; In addition to its regular
	advertising program, the Company conducts numerous special promotions and
	handicapping contests to increase simulcast patronage and maintains successful
	pari-mutuel player and card room player rewards programs.&#160; In addition, the development and maintenance
	of a customer database over the past several years has enabled the Company to
	effectively utilize direct mail advertising.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Because wagering on horse
	racing and playing poker and table games are more complex than many other forms
	of gaming, such as slot machines or various lottery products, the Company
	continues to develop and conduct various educational programs, such as
	complimentary poker and table games lessons, tours of the Racetrack, wagering
	and handicapping classes and contests that it believes will make pari-mutuel
	wagering on horse racing and card playing more understandable to the general
	public.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(ix)
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.5PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Employees
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	At March&nbsp;25, 2010, the
	Company had 269 full-time employees and 246 part-time employees.&#160; On a seasonal basis, the Company adds
	approximately 120 full-time and 250 part-time employees for live racing
	operations from early May&nbsp;until early September.&#160; The Company&#146;s management believes its
	employee relations are good.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(x)
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.5PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Executive Officers
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The executive officers of
	the Company, their ages and their positions with the Company are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

</TD>
<TD WIDTH="63%" VALIGN="TOP" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:63.28%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Vice President of
	Facilities
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="23%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:23.32%;">

	&nbsp;

<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:2.84%;">

<TD WIDTH="63%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:63.28%;">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="23%" VALIGN="TOP" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:23.32%;">

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Michael J. Garin
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:2.84%;">

<TD WIDTH="63%" VALIGN="TOP" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:63.28%;">

</EFX_NAME_AND_TITLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Randall D. Sampson has
	been President and Chief Executive Officer since the formation of the Company
	in March&nbsp;1994 and General Manager since September&nbsp;1995.&#160; He has been active in horse industry
	associations, currently serving as Vice President and Director of the
	Thoroughbred Racetracks of America and is a past President of the Minnesota
	Thoroughbred Association.&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Sampson
	also currently serves as a director of Communications Systems,&nbsp;Inc.
	(NASDAQ:JCS), a manufacturer of telecommunications and data communications
	products based in Hector, Minnesota.&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Sampson
	is the son of Curtis A. Sampson, the Company&#146;s Chairman of the Board and the
	beneficial owner of approximately 22% of the Company&#146;s common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	10
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_PB_10_155812_8146">
</A>
</FONT>
