<A NAME="eolPage11"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A09-35889_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of
	Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	David
	C. Hansen joined the Company in July&nbsp;2001 as Vice President of Finance and
	Chief Financial Officer.&#160; From 2000 to
	2001, Mr.&nbsp;Hansen served as Director of Accounting for Prairie Meadows
	Racetrack and Casino in Altoona, IA, one of the nation&#146;s first Racino
	operations.&#160; He served as Controller and
	later Director of Finance at Treasure Island Resort&nbsp;&amp; Casino, in Red
	Wing, MN, from 1993 until 2000.&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Hansen
	earned his CPA certification in 1983.&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Hansen
	is a member of the Minnesota Society of Certified Public Accountants, the
	Hospitality Financial and Technology Professionals Association, and the
	Financial Executives International.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Mark A. Erickson has been
	Vice President of Facilities since May&nbsp;1997, serving as the Racetrack&#146;s
	Director of Facilities since April&nbsp;1994.&#160;
	From 1992 to 1994, Mr.&nbsp;Erickson served as Maintenance Supervisor
	for the Mall of America, supervising the interior maintenance for one of the largest
	shopping malls in North America.&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Erickson
	was Master Electrician for Canterbury Downs from 1986 to 1992, supervising the
	installation and maintenance of all electrical equipment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Michael J. Garin was
	recently named Vice President of Non-Gaming Operations in October&nbsp;2009.&#160; Prior thereto, Mr.&nbsp;Garin served as the
	Vice President of Hospitality since May&nbsp;of 1997.&#160; He also previously served as President of
	Canterbury Park Concessions,&nbsp;Inc. from September&nbsp;1995 to May&nbsp;of
	1997.&#160; From 1993 to 1994, Mr.&nbsp;Garin
	served as Food&nbsp;&amp; Beverage Supervisor for Little Six,&nbsp;Inc., one of
	the largest tribal casino operations in the country.&#160; Mr.&nbsp;Garin was President of MMR Vending,&nbsp;Inc.,
	a regional vending company, from 1988 to 1992.&#160;
	Prior to 1988, he was a Regional Director at General Mills Restaurant
	Group overseeing seven restaurants in three states.&#160; Since 2007, Mr.&nbsp;Garin has served on the
	Board of Directors for the Minnesota Restaurant Association.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_RISK_FACTORS>
<A NAME="FIS_RISK_FACTORS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Item
	1A.&#160; RISK FACTORS
</FONT>
</B>
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_ITEM1A_RISKFACTORS_162914">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company is subject to
	risk factors that may affect our operating results.&#160; Such risk factors include, but are not
	limited to, the matters discussed below as well as the additional risks
	discussed under Forward Looking Statements on page&nbsp;27 of this Form&nbsp;10-K
	for additional risks to which the Company is exposed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	We face
	significant competition from other gaming operations that could have a material
	adverse effect on our operations.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We face intense
	competition in our market, particularly competition from tribal casinos.&#160; Such facilities have the advantage of being
	exempt from certain state and federal taxes and state regulation of indoor
	smoking.&#160; We also compete with illegal
	Internet wagering on horse races, other forms of gambling, other forms of
	entertainment and other racetracks throughout the country as previously
	discussed under
<I>
	Competition
</I>
	above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In early 2005, the MRC
	granted a license to NMHI to construct and operate a harness racetrack in
	Columbus Township, Anoka County, MN, which is approximately 50 miles from the
	Racetrack.&#160; This license authorized NMHI
	to engage in pari-mutuel wagering on live and simulcast racing for standardbred
	(harness) horses.&#160; This racetrack opened
	in April&nbsp;of 2008 as Running Aces Harness Park (&#147;Running Aces&#148;).&#160; In addition, Running Aces began card room
	operations in June&nbsp;of 2008.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We expect competition for
	our existing and future operations to increase both from Running Aces and
	existing tribal casinos.&#160; In addition,
	several of our tribal gaming competitors have substantially larger marketing and
	financial resources than we do.&#160; We are
	unable to predict with any certainty the effects of existing and future
	competition on our operating results.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	A
	downturn in general economic conditions can adversely affect our results of
	operations.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Consumer demand for
	entertainment is particularly sensitive to downturns in the economy and the
	corresponding impact on discretionary spending on leisure activities.&#160; Changes in discretionary consumer spending or
	consumer preferences could be driven by factors such as perceived or actual
	general economic conditions including housing prices and the availability of
	credit; high energy, fuel and food costs; the increased cost of travel; the
	potential for bank failures; the weakening job market; perceived or actual
	disposable consumer income and wealth; fears of recession and changes in
	consumer confidence in the economy; or fears of war and future acts of
	terrorism.&#160; These factors could reduce
	consumer demand for the leisure activities we offer, thus imposing practical
	limits on pricing and harming our operations.&#160;
	Our revenues and profitability have
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	11
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_PB_11_162213_7091">
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="#010101" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='11',FILE='C:\JMS\JBRITTO\09-35889-1\TASK4021128\35889-1-BC.HTM',USER='105166',CD='MAR 30 20:13 2010' -->
<A NAME="eolPage12"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A09-35889_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	been adversely affected
	by these factors during the last two years and are likely to be adversely
	affected in 2010.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	We are
	subject to extensive regulation from gaming authorities that could adversely
	affect us.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The ownership and
	operation of our Racetrack and card room are subject to significant regulation
	by the MRC under the Racing Act and the rules&nbsp;adopted by the MRC.&#160; The MRC has the authority to impose increases
	in the Class&nbsp;A and Class&nbsp;B license fees.&#160; In addition, State law requires that we
	reimburse the MRC for its actual costs of regulating the card room, including
	personnel costs.&#160; Increases in these
	licensing and regulatory costs could adversely affect our results of
	operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Decisions by the MRC in
	regard to any one or more of the following matters could also adversely affect
	the Company&#146;s operations: the granting of operating licenses to Canterbury Park
	and other racetracks after an application process and public hearings; the
	licensing of all employees of a racetrack, jockeys, trainers, veterinarians and
	other participants; regulating the transfer of ownership interests in licenses;
	allocating live race days and simulcast-only race days; approving race
	programs; regulating the conduct of races; setting specifications for the
	racing ovals, animal facilities, employee quarters and public areas of
	racetracks; changes to the types of wagers on horse races; and approval of
	significant contractual agreements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	We are
	subject to changes in the laws that govern our business, including the
	possibility of an increase in gaming taxes, which would increase our costs, and
	changes in other laws may adversely affect our ability to compete.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Our operations and
	oversight by the MRC are ultimately subject to the laws of Minnesota and there
	exists the risk that these laws may be amended in ways adverse to our
	operations.&#160; In particular, we are
	required to pay taxes and fees in addition to normal federal, state and local
	income taxes, and such taxes and fees are subject to increase at any time.&#160; From time to time, state and local
	legislators and officials have proposed changes in tax laws, or in the
	administration of laws affecting our industry, such as the allocation of each
	wagering pool to winning bettors, the Racetrack, purses and the MBF.&#160; In addition, poor economic conditions could
	intensify the efforts of state and local governments to raise revenues through
	increases in gaming taxes.&#160; It is not
	possible to determine with certainty the likelihood of changes in tax laws or
	in the administration of such laws.&#160; Such
	changes, if adopted, could have a material adverse effect on our operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We are also subject to
	laws in Minnesota that affect businesses generally.&#160; It is
	possible, as a result of the legislative process, that legislation directly or
	indirectly adverse to the Company may be enacted into law.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	We Depend on Key Personnel.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Our future success will
	depend largely on the skills, efforts and motivation of Randall D. Sampson, our
	President and Chief Executive Officer, and other executive officers and key
	personnel, on whom we are highly dependent. Our inability to retain key
	personnel could have a material, adverse impact on our business, financial
	condition and results of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Energy
	and fuel price increases may adversely affect our costs of operations and our
	revenues.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Our facility uses
	significant amounts of electricity, natural gas and other forms of energy.&#160; Increases in the cost of electricity or
	natural gas negatively affect our results of operations.&#160; In addition, energy and fuel price increases
	could negatively impact our operations by reducing disposable income of
	potential customers and decreasing visitation to our facility.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_RISK_FACTORS>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNRESOLVED_STAFF_COMMENTS>
<A NAME="FIS_UNRESOLVED_STAFF_COMMENTS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Item
	1B.&#160; UNRESOLVED STAFF COMMENTS
</FONT>
</B>
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_ITEM1B_UNRESOLVEDSTAFFCOMMENTS_162929">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Not
	Applicable.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	12
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_PB_12_162304_455">
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="#010101" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='12',FILE='C:\JMS\JBRITTO\09-35889-1\TASK4021128\35889-1-BC.HTM',USER='105166',CD='MAR 30 20:13 2010' -->
<A NAME="eolPage13"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A09-35889_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_UNRESOLVED_STAFF_COMMENTS>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_PART_I>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_I"></A>
<EFX_PROPERTIES>
<A NAME="FIS_PROPERTIES"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Item 2.&#160; PROPERTIES
</FONT>
</B>
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_ITEM2_PROPERTIES_162940">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	General.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company&#146;s facilities,
	which are owned and operated under the name &#147;Canterbury Park,&#148; are a modern
	complex of buildings and grounds, generally comparable to other major
	racetracks located throughout the country.&#160;
	The Racetrack&#146;s grandstand has a patron capacity of approximately 10,000
	within enclosed areas and a maximum patron capacity of over 30,000 including
	outside areas around the grandstand.&#160; The
	grandstand and most public outdoor areas contain numerous pari-mutuel windows,
	odds information boards, video monitors, concessions stands and other
	amenities.&#160; The audio/visual system
	includes over 600 television monitors with most areas providing multi-screen
	viewing of the races.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Racetrack is located
	approximately 25 miles southwest of downtown Minneapolis.&#160; The area immediately surrounding the
	Racetrack consists of commercial and industrial buildings, farmland and
	residential areas.&#160; The Racetrack is in
	reasonable proximity to a number of major entertainment destinations
	including:&#160; Valleyfair, an amusement park
	about two miles from the Racetrack which annually attracts approximately more
	than one million visitors during the spring and summer; the Renaissance
	Festival, a seven-weekend late summer annual event attracting approximately
	300,000 visitors, located about five miles from the Racetrack; and Mystic Lake
	Casino, located about four miles from the Racetrack, which draws approximately
	5.2 million patrons annually.&#160; The Mall of
	America, the largest enclosed shopping mall in the United States, which
	attracts more than 40 million visitors per year, is approximately 17 miles from
	the Racetrack.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Racing
	Surfaces.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The racing surfaces
	consist of a one-mile oval dirt/limestone track and a 7/8 mile oval turf
	course.&#160; The dirt track includes a mile
	and one-quarter front stretch chute, a 6-1/2 furlong backstretch chute and a
	3-&#189; furlong chute and is lighted for night racing.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Grandstand.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The grandstand is a
	modern, air-conditioned enclosed structure of approximately 275,000 square feet
	with a variety of facilities on six levels.&#160;
	The lower level contains space for support functions such as jockey
	quarters, administrative offices, Racing Commission offices, first aid,
	mechanical and electrical rooms.&#160; The
	track level includes pari-mutuel windows, restrooms, a variety of concession
	stands and other services as well as the card room, which occupies 22,000
	square feet on the track level.&#160; The
	mezzanine level contains 1,320 fixed seats in a glass-enclosed, air-conditioned
	area and an additional 3,000 seats located outside.&#160; In addition to the seats, the mezzanine level
	contains pari-mutuel windows, restrooms, concession stands and other guest
	facilities.&#160; A portion of the mezzanine
	level is currently being used as a simulcast center during live racing, and for
	banquets and other events during the off-season.&#160; The kitchen level is an intermediate level
	located between the mezzanine and clubhouse floors.&#160; It contains a full-service kitchen which supports
	a full dining menu for the track-side dining terraces on the clubhouse level
	and food preparation for the other concession areas.&#160; The clubhouse level is a multi-purpose area
	serving as a simulcast center during wagering sessions on televised races, as
	well as a full-service dining area during the live racing season.&#160; The clubhouse level includes 325 trackside
	tables, each equipped with a television set, with a total seating capacity of
	1,200 patrons and an additional 1,000 seats are located in lounges located
	throughout the area.&#160; The press box and
	officials&#146; level is located in the roof trusses over the clubhouse and contains
	work areas for the press, racing officials, closed-circuit television, photo
	finish and the track announcer.&#160; In
	addition, the grandstand was structurally built to accommodate skyboxes under
	the press box/officials&#146; level, although none have yet been constructed.&#160; Escalators and elevators are available to
	move patrons among the various levels within the grandstand.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Barn and
	Backside Facilities.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The stable area consists
	of 33 barns with a total of approximately 1,650 stalls.&#160; In the stable area, there are 216 dormitory
	rooms for the grooms and others working at the Racetrack.&#160; The stable area also contains a combination
	racing office and cafeteria/recreation building for stable personnel, two
	blacksmith buildings and a one half-mile training track.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	13
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_PB_13_162353_4141">
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="#010101" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='13',FILE='C:\JMS\JBRITTO\09-35889-1\TASK4021128\35889-1-BC.HTM',USER='105166',CD='MAR 30 20:13 2010' -->
<A NAME="eolPage14"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A09-35889_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Parking.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Approximately 7,500 paved
	parking spaces are available for patron and employee automobiles at the
	Racetrack, including parking spaces that are reserved for handicapped
	patrons.&#160; The Racetrack also has unpaved
	areas available for overflow parking for approximately 5,000 additional
	automobiles.&#160; Areas are also reserved for
	bus parking.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	RV
	Park.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company owns and
	operates a recreational vehicle (RV) park, located two miles from the Racetrack
	in Shakopee, Minnesota on approximately 29 acres adjacent to the Minnesota
	River.&#160; The RV Park has 68 independent
	sites and 40 dependent sites, an indoor swimming pool, laundry facilities, game
	room and mini store.&#160; In 2010, this
	property is being leased to an unaffiliated party, and it is expected the
	lessee will operate the RV Park similar to how it has been operated in the
	past, with sites being rented to horsemen participating in Canterbury&#146;s racing
	operations, seasonal employees and the general public.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Undeveloped
	Land.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Approximately 100 acres
	of the 380 acres owned by the Company are not necessary for current
	operations.&#160; This property could be sold
	in whole or in part, depending upon future opportunities.&#160; The Company regularly evaluates other
	business activities and development opportunities that would maximize the use
	of the real estate surrounding the Racetrack and which would complement the
	Company&#146;s primary businesses of horse racing and card room operations.&#160; In June&nbsp;2008, the Company announced that
	it had entered into a letter of intent with RED Development, LLC, a Kansas City
	based retail developer, to be its exclusive partner in a proposed retail and
	entertainment development on part of the Company&#146;s property.&#160; Although the Company has remained in
	communication with RED Development, due to the prolonged economic recession,
	the project was put on hold as retailers curbed their expansion efforts.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Use of
	Properites.
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	All three Company&#146;s
	operating segments are housed in the Grandstand and use the parking
	facilities.&#160; The racing surfaces, barns,
	and backside facilities are used exclusively by the Horse Racing segment.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_PROPERTIES>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS>
<A NAME="FIS_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Item
	3.&#160; LEGAL PROCEEDINGS
</FONT>
</B>
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_ITEM3_LEGALPROCEEDINGS_162956">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	There are no material
	legal proceedings pending against the Company.&#160;
	From time to time, the Company is party to ordinary and routine
	litigation incidental to our business.&#160;
	We do not expect the outcome of any such litigation pending at this time
	to have a material adverse effect on our consolidated financial position or
	results of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">

</FONT>
</B>
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_ITEM4_REMOVEDANDRESERVED_163001">

</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">

<EFX_PART_II>

</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;

</P>
<EFX_MARKET>
<A NAME="FIS_MARKET"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Item 5.&#160; MARKET
	FOR REGISTRANT&#146;S COMMON EQUITY, RELATED STOCKHOLDER MATTERS AND ISSUER
	PURCHASES OF EQUITY SECURITIES
</FONT>
</B>
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_ITEM5_MARKETFORREGISTRANTSCOMMONE_172007">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(a)
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.5PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	MARKET INFORMATION
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company&#146;s common
	stock trades on the NASDAQ Global Market under the symbol CPHC.&#160; Prior to August&nbsp;26, 2008, it traded on
	the American Stock Exchange under the symbol ECP.&#160; The table set forth below indicates the high
	and low sale prices for the Common Stock in the quarterly periods ending December&nbsp;31,
	2009 and 2008.
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_5"></A>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;WIDTH:100.0%;">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:51.0%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:2.0%;">
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="22%" COLSPAN="5" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID WINDOWTEXT 1.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:22.0%;">
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	2009
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(1)&nbsp;The
	Company does not have individual compensation arrangements involving the
	granting of options, warrants, rights or restricted stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(2)&nbsp;Adopted by the
	Company&#146;s Board of Directors in 1997, the purpose of the Stock Option Plan for Non-Employee
	Consultants and Advisors is to attract and retain the services of experienced
	and knowledgeable non-employee consultants and advisors to assist in projects
	having strategic significance for the Company, to provide an alternative form
	of cash compensation to such persons and to provide such persons with the
	opportunity to participate in the Company&#146;s long term progress and success.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:3.0PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(h)
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.5PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	PURCHASES OF EQUITY SECURITIES BY THE ISSUER
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On January&nbsp;16,
	2008, the Company announced that its Board of Directors had authorized a
	program to repurchase up to an additional 250,000 shares of the Company&#146;s
	common stock pursuant to Exchange Act Rule&nbsp;12b-18 in open market
	transactions, block purchases of privately negotiated transactions.&#160; During the fiscal year 2009, the Company did
	not repurchase any shares of common stock.&#160;
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2009, there are 33,457 shares that the Company
	may buy back as a result of this repurchase program.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>

<EFX_FINANCIAL_DATA>
<A NAME="FIS_FINANCIAL_DATA"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Item 6.&#160; SELECTED FINANCIAL DATA
</FONT>
</B>
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_ITEM6_SELECTEDFINANCIALDATA_172036">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The following table sets
	forth selected consolidated financial data for each of the five fiscal years
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2009.&#160; The
	operating and balance sheet data for the years ended and as of December&nbsp;31,
	2009, 2008, 2007, 2006, and 2005 are derived from our audited consolidated
	financial statements.&#160; The following
	information should be read in conjunction with &#147;Management&#146;s Discussion and
	Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations&#148; and with our
	consolidated financial statements and the related notes thereto included
	elsewhere in this report.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(In thousands except for
	per share amounts)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.5IN;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Item
</FONT>
</B>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	7.&#160; MANAGEMENT&#146;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF
	FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
</FONT>
</B>
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_ITEM7_MANAGEMENTSDISCUSSIONANDANA_172051">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The following Management&#146;s
	Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations (&#147;MD&amp;A&#148;)
	is intended to help the reader understand Canterbury Park Holding Corporation,
	our operations and our present business environment.&#160; This MD&amp;A is provided as a supplement to &#151;
	and should be read in conjunction with &#151; our consolidated financial statements
	and the accompanying notes to the financial statements (the &#147;Notes&#148;).&#160; Our actual results could differ materially
	from those anticipated in the forward-looking statements included in this
	discussion as a result of certain factors, including, but not limited to, those
	discussed in &#147;Risk Factors&#148; and &#147;Forward-Looking Statements&#148; included elsewhere
	in this Annual Report.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<U>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	STRATEGIC
	OVERVIEW
</FONT>
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Canterbury Park Holding
	Corporation was incorporated under the laws of Minnesota and acquired land and
	buildings to conduct pari-mutuel horse racing operations in March&nbsp;1994.&#160; The Racetrack is located in Shakopee,
	Minnesota, approximately 25 miles southwest of downtown Minneapolis.&#160; In May&nbsp;1994, we commenced year-round
	pari-mutuel simulcast wagering operations and during the summer of 1995, we
	hosted the first annual live race meet.&#160;
	Our live racing operations are a seasonal business as we host live race
	meets each year from May&nbsp;until late summer.&#160; We earn additional pari-mutuel revenue by
	televising our live racing to out-of-state racetracks around the country.&#160; We also derive revenues from related services
	and activities, such as advertising, admissions, parking and publication sales
	and from other entertainment events and activities held at the Racetrack.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In April&nbsp;2000, we
	opened Canterbury Park&#146;s card room.&#160; The
	card room operates 24 hours a day, seven days a week and is limited by
	Minnesota State law to a maximum of 50 tables.&#160;
	The card room currently offers a mix of both poker and table games up to
	this State maximum table limit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Our three largest
	sources of revenues, card room operations, pari-mutuel operations and
	concessions sales, generate cash revenues.&#160;
	Consequently, the Company is highly liquid and has not utilized its line
	of credit in over six years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_8"></A>

</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="10%" COLSPAN="2" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID WINDOWTEXT 1.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:10.72%;">
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">

</P>

	3,053
</FONT>

</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:1.04%;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The primary strengths of
	Canterbury Park are our dedicated and capable staff, our first-class facilities
	and 380-acre property and the legal authority to offer our unique gaming
	products in our market area.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Our management
	team has extensive knowledge of the horse racing and card businesses and our
	staff has demonstrated a commitment to our customers.&#160; We continue to implement improvements to our comprehensive customer satisfaction
	measurement and enhancement program. &#160;Our management team has a good relationship
	with our workforce and is able to retain qualified personnel as demonstrated by
	our low turnover rate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Our facilities are modern
	by racetrack industry standards, and we have invested heavily in the past few
	years to update and upgrade them to meet the needs of our customers and
	horsemen.&#160; Our 380-acre property with a
	prime location on the edge of the Minneapolis &#151; St. Paul metropolitan area in
	one of the fastest-growing counties in Minnesota provides us with great
	long-term growth and development opportunities.&#160;
	Our Board of
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	18
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_PB_18_165617_563">
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="#010101" ALIGN="LEFT">

<A NAME="eolPage19"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A09-35889_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Directors is engaged in
	an evaluation of the highest and best potential uses of our underutilized
	land.&#160; Our long-term strategic direction
	is to enhance the character of our property as a unique gaming and
	entertainment destination.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We have a strong
	commitment to live racing and have been particularly successful in attracting
	new customers and providing a quality live racing experience for our horse
	racing fans as well as the horsemen who enter their horses in live races at
	Canterbury Park.&#160; The success of the card
	room has greatly enhanced our ability to offer a more competitive purse
	structure for live racing and has allowed us to make significant improvements
	to our Grandstand and the backside stabling and training facilities.&#160; As a result, we have been near capacity for
	horses stabled at Canterbury Park during our recent live race meets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We continue to believe
	that our best option for long-term growth is to gain authority under Minnesota
	law to offer additional gaming options,
	which would enhance horse racing with increased purses, provide growth and
	development opportunities and produce significant new tax revenues for state
	and local governments.&#160; The effort to
	obtain legislative authority for these initiatives has required, and will continue
	to require, substantial expenditures.&#160;
	Due to the inherent uncertainty of the outcome of legislative
	activities, there can be no assurance that any bills favorable to the Company&#146;s
	interests will be enacted into law, and it is possible, as a result of the
	legislative process, that legislation directly or indirectly adverse to the
	Company may be enacted into law.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<U>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	CURRENT
	DEVELOPMENTS
</FONT>
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In January&nbsp;2010, the
	Company began an extensive remodeling project in our card room.&#160; As a result, the card room was moved to a
	temporary location on the mezzanine level on January&nbsp;25, 2010.&#160; The Company plans to reopen the card room in
	its original location in April&nbsp;2010.&#160;
	The remodeling project is being conducted to redesign and enhance
	virtually every aspect of the room, including the d&#233;cor, entrance, location of
	the bathrooms, and even the chairs.&#160; We
	believe our customers will find that the remodel will greatly enhance their
	gaming experience, which will result in increased revenues.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<B>
<U>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	CRITICAL ACCOUNTING POLICIES AND ESTIMATES
</FONT>
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	preparation of consolidated financial statements in conformity with generally
	accepted accounting principles in the United States of America requires
	management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts
	of assets and liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities
	at the date of the consolidated financial statements and the reported amounts
	of revenues and expenses during the reporting period.&#160; We base our assumptions, estimates and
	judgments on historical experience, current trends and other factors that
	management believes to be relevant at the time the consolidated financial
	statements are prepared.&#160; On a regular
	basis, management reviews the accounting policies, assumptions, estimates and
	judgments to ensure that our financial statements are presented fairly and in
	accordance with generally accepted accounting principles.&#160; However, because future events and their
	effects cannot be determined with certainty, actual results could differ from
	our assumptions and estimates, and such differences could be material.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Our
	significant accounting policies are included in Note 1 to our consolidated
	financial statements.&#160; We believe the
	following critical accounting policies affect our more significant judgments
	and estimates used in the preparation of our consolidated financial statements:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Property
	and Equipment -
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We
	have significant capital invested in our property and equipment, which
	represents approximately 75.1% of our total assets at December&nbsp;31,
	2009.&#160; We utilize our judgment in various
	ways including: determining whether an expenditure is considered a maintenance
	expense or a capital asset; determining the estimated useful lives of assets;
	and determining if or when an asset has been impaired.&#160; Management periodically reviews the carrying
	value of property and equipment for potential impairment by comparing the
	carrying value of these assets with their related expected future net cash
	flows.&#160; Should the sum of the related
	expected future net cash flows be less than the carrying value, we will determine
	whether an impairment loss should be recognized.&#160; An impairment loss would be measured by the
	amount by which the carrying value of the asset exceeds the fair value of the
	asset.&#160; To date, we have determined that
	no impairment of these assets exists.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	19
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_PB_19_165748_9497">

<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A09-35889_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Stock
	Based Employee Compensation
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#151; ASC 718, Compensation &#151; Stock Compensation (&#147;ASC
	718&#148;), requires recognition of employee services provided in exchange for a
	share-based payment based on the grant date fair market value.&#160; We utilize our judgment in determining the
	assumptions used to determine the fair value of options granted using a
	Black-Scholes model.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<H5 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID;">
<B>
<I>
<U>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NEW ACCOUNTING PRONOUNCEMENTS
</FONT>
</U>
</I>
</B>
</H5>
<H5 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</I>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In
	June&nbsp;2009, the Financial Accounting Standards Board, (&#147;FASB&#148;) issued
	Accounting Standards Codification (&#147;ASC&#148;) 105,
<I>
	Generally
	Accepted Accounting Principles
</I>
	(&#147;ASC 105&#148;).&nbsp;&nbsp;ASC 105
	establishes the FASB Accounting Standards Codification (&#147;Codification&#148;) as the
	source of authoritative accounting principles recognized by the FASB to be
	applied by nongovernment entities in the preparation of financial statements in
	conformity with GAAP.&nbsp;&nbsp;Rules&nbsp;and interpretive releases of the SEC
	under authority of federal securities law are also sources of authoritative
	GAAP for SEC registrants.&nbsp; References to FASB guidance throughout this
	document have been updated for the Codification.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Company adopted an update to ASC 805 &#151;
<I>
	Business Combinations
</I>
	(&#147;ASC
	805&#148;)&nbsp;on January&nbsp;1, 2009.&nbsp;&nbsp;ASC 805 establishes principles
	and requirements for how the acquirer of a business recognizes and measures in
	its financial statements the identifiable assets acquired, the liabilities
	assumed, and any noncontrolling interest in the acquiree.&#160; The statement also provides guidance for
	recognizing and measuring the goodwill acquired in the business combination and
	determines what information to disclose to enable users of the financial
	statements to evaluate the nature and financial effects of the business
	combination. This update had no material impact on the Company&#146;s financial
	position, results of operations or cash flows.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.5PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company adopted an update to&nbsp;ASC
	820 &#151;
<I>
	Fair Value Measurement and Disclosures
</I>
	&nbsp;(&#147;ASC
	820&#148;) January&nbsp;1, 2009 for non-financial assets.&nbsp;&nbsp;ASC 820 defines
	fair value, establishes a framework for measuring fair value, and expands
	disclosures about fair value measurement.&nbsp;&nbsp;ASC 820 also emphasizes
	that fair value is a market-based measurement, not an entity-specific
	measurement, and sets out a fair value hierarchy with the highest priority
	being quoted prices in active markets.&nbsp;&nbsp;Under ASC 820, fair value
	measurements are disclosed by level within that hierarchy.&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company adopted ASC 820 for the fiscal year beginning January&nbsp;1, 2008 for
	financial assets.&#160; The adoption of ASC
	820&nbsp;and the update had no material impact on the Company&#146;s financial
	position, results of operations, or cash flows.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company
	adopted an update to ASC 855 &#151;
<I>
	Subsequent Events
</I>
	(&#147;ASC 855&#148;) on April&nbsp;1, 2009.&nbsp;&nbsp;ASC 855 provides guidance on when
	a subsequent event should be recognized in the financial statements. Subsequent
	events that provide additional evidence about conditions that existed at the
	date of the balance sheet should be recognized at the balance sheet date.&#160; Subsequent events that provide evidence about
	conditions that arose after the balance sheet date but before financial
	statements are issued, or are available to be issued, are not required to be
	recognized.&#160; The date through which
	subsequent events have been evaluated must be disclosed as well as whether it
	is the date the financial statements were issued or the date the financial
	statements were available to be issued.&#160;
	For non-recognized subsequent events which should be disclosed to keep
	the financial statements from being misleading, the nature of the event and an
	estimate of its financial effect, or a statement that such an estimate cannot
	be made, should be disclosed. The standard is effective for interim or annual
	periods ending after June&nbsp;15, 2009.&#160;
	The adoption of ASC 855 and the update had no material impact on the
	Company&#146;s financial position, results of operations, or cash flows.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<B>
<U>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	CONTINGENCIES
</FONT>
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In
	connection with the purchase of the Racetrack, the Company entered into an Earn
	Out Promissory Note dated March&nbsp;29, 1994. In accordance with the Earn Out
	Note, if (i)&nbsp;off-track betting becomes legally permissible in the State of
	Minnesota and (ii)&nbsp;we begin to conduct off-track betting with respect to
	or in connection with its operations, we will be required to pay to the IMR
	Fund, L.P. the greater of $700,000 per operating year as defined, or 20% of the
	net pretax profit as defined, for each of five operating years.&#160; At this time, we believe that the likelihood
	that these two conditions will be met and that we will be required to pay these
	amounts is remote.&#160; At the date (if any)
	that these two conditions are met, the five minimum payments will be discounted
	back to their present value and the sum of those discounted payments will be
	capitalized as part of the purchase price in accordance with generally accepted
	accounting principles.&#160; The purchase
	price will be
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	20
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_PB_20_165811_3641">
</A>
</FONT>
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage21"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A09-35889_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of
	Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	further increased if
	payments become due under the &#147;20% of Net Pretax Profit&#148; calculation.&#160; The first payment is to be made 90 days after
	the end of the third operating year in which off-track betting is conducted by
	us.&#160; Remaining payments would be made
	within 90 days of the end of each of the next four operating years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Company is periodically involved in various claims and legal actions arising in
	the normal course of business.&#160;
	Management believes that the resolution of any pending claims and legal
	actions at December&nbsp;31, 2009 and as of the date of this report will not
	have a material impact on the consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	EBITDA represents
	earnings before interest income, income tax expense, and depreciation and
	amortization.&#160; EBITDA is not a measure of
	performance or liquidity calculated in accordance with generally accepted
	accounting principles (&#147;GAAP&#148;), and should not be considered an alternative to,
	or more meaningful than, net income as an indicator of our operating
	performance, or cash flows from operating activities as a measure of
	liquidity.&#160; EBITDA has been presented as
	a supplemental disclosure because it is a widely used measure of performance
	and basis for valuation of companies in our industry.&#160; Moreover, other companies that provide EBITDA
	information may calculate EBITDA differently than we do.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	EBITDA decreased slightly
	as a percentage of net revenues to 5.9% for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2009 compared to 6.2% for the year ended December, 2008.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Total
	net operating revenues for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 were $39.6
	million, a decrease of $6,436,824, or 14.0%, compared to total operating
	revenues of $46.0 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008.&#160; Total card room revenues decreased 16.7%,
	pari-mutuel revenues decreased 14.7% and concession revenues decreased 11.4% in
	fiscal 2009 compared to fiscal 2008.&#160;&#160;
	Discussions of pari-mutuel and card room revenues follow.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	21
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_PB_21_170257_5250">
</A>
</FONT>
</P>

<B>

	SUMMARY
	OF PARI-MUTUEL OPERATING DATA:

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="83%" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;WIDTH:83.34%;">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="63%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:63.98%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:3.0%;">
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="14%" COLSPAN="2" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:14.4%;">

</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:1.22%;">

</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Pari-mutuel revenues
	include commission and breakage revenues on live on-track and simulcast racing,
	fees received from out-of-state racetracks for wagering on our live races and
	proceeds from uncashed winning tickets.&#160;
	Pari-mutuel revenues decreased to $11.4 million in 2009 from $13.3
	million in 2008, primarily reflecting a decrease in simulcast and on-track live
	racing handle in 2009 compared to 2008.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Total handle wagered on
	simulcast races in 2009 decreased $7,509,000, or 16.4%, compared to 2008.&#160; The decrease is attributable to the severe
	recession and economic uncertainty that has adversely impacted discretionary
	spending on entertainment.&#160; These
	conditions, which began in 2008, have continued to erode revenues throughout
	the fiscal year 2009.&#160; In addition, the
	Company now faces direct pari-mutuel competition from Running Aces Harness Park
	(&#147;Running Aces&#148;), a harness track that opened in Anoka County in April&nbsp;2008.&#160; The Company also believes that an increasing
	number of Minnesota residents are unlawfully wagering on horse races by means
	of the Internet.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On-track live handle
	decreased by $1,667,000, or 12.0%, for the 2009 live meet compared to the live
	meet in 2008.&#160; The decrease is partially
	due to the Company conducting 81 fewer races during 2009.&#160; Also, the economic recession has adversely
	impacted discretionary spending on entertainment, which has also adversely
	affected on-track handle.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Wagering at out-of-state
	tracks on races conducted at the Racetrack during the 2009 live meet decreased
	$6,078,000, or 30.7%, compared to the 2008 meet primarily due to the severe
	recession and economic uncertainty prevailing throughout the country.&#160; In addition, the Company conducted 81 fewer
	races during 2009, which led to a decrease in out-of-state handle.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Revenues
	recognized on proceeds from winning pari-mutuel tickets which were not
	presented for payment within one year of the end of the respective race meets
	decreased approximately $62,000 in 2009 compared to 2008, primarily due to
	reduced amounts wagered on simulcast horse races.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	22
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_PB_22_171006_7672">
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="#010101" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:2.68%;">

	&nbsp;

</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:1.02%;">

	&nbsp;

</TD>

	Number
	of Days Offered
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:2.68%;">

	&nbsp;

</P>

</TD>

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Average
	Revenue per Day
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:2.68%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;">
	&nbsp;

</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:1.3%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	$
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:11.56%;">
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	55,400
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:2.68%;">

	$
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="11%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:11.56%;">
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	66,500
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:1.02%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
