</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The primary source of
	card room revenue is a percentage of the wagers received from the players as
	compensation for providing the card room facility and services, referred to as &#147;collection
	revenue&#148;.&#160; Other Revenue presented above
	includes fees collected for the administration of tournaments and amounts
	earned as reimbursement for the administrative costs of maintaining the jackpot
	funds.&#160; Card room revenues represent
	50.9% and 52.5% of net revenues for 2009 and 2008, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	card room is divided into two areas, the poker area and the table games
	area.&#160; The average daily collection
	amount per game is dependent upon the number of tables utilized to offer the
	game.&#160; Patron demand determines the
	number of tables to be used for a specific game.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Total
	card room revenue decreased $4,045,000, or 16.7%, compared to 2008.&#160; The decrease in card room revenue is due
	primarily to the decrease in poker revenue of $4,090,000, or 26.2%, in 2009
	over 2008.&#160; The decrease is attributable
	to the economic recession that has adversely impacted discretionary spending on
	entertainment.&#160; The economic recession,
	which began in 2008, has continued to erode revenues throughout 2009.&#160; In addition, the Company now faces direct
	card room competition from Running Aces, who began their card room operations
	on June&nbsp;30, 2008.&#160; The Company
	believes patronage at Running Aces card room has had a material adverse effect
	on the Company&#146;s card room revenue.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We expect that
	competition from Running Aces, illegal Internet wagering, wagering at tribal
	casinos will continue to put pressure on card room operating revenues in future
	periods.&#160; As a result, we continue to
	search for opportunities to make Canterbury Park the most attractive
	alternative when our customers want to wager on card games.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Concession revenues
	decreased $682,000, or 11.4%, compared to 2008.&#160;
	The decrease is primarily attributable to the decrease in simulcast and
	card room patronage.&#160; Additionally, there
	were five less live race days in 2009, resulting in decreased concessions
	revenues.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Other
	revenue increased $211,000, or 7.7%, to $2,952,000 in fiscal year 2009 compared
	to 2008.&#160; The increase in 2009 was due
	primarily to an increase in special events that were held at the
	facilities.&#160; Promotional allowances
	decreased $36,000, or 15.9%, to $192,000 in 2009, also as a result of decreased
	patronage of the card room.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AUTO;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	OPERATING EXPENSES
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AUTO;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Total operating expenses
	decreased approximately $5,947,000, or 13.1%, to $39,363,000 in 2009, from
	$45,310,000 in 2008 primarily due to decreases in purses and other pari-mutuel
	expenses, as well as reductions in several expense areas, including salaries
	and benefits and utilities.&#160; See below
	for a detailed quantification of each of these items.&#160; Total operating expenses as a percentage of
	net revenues increased slightly to 99.4% from 98.4% in 2008.&#160; We experienced a considerable decrease in
	pari-mutuel and card room revenues in 2009.&#160;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	23
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_PB_23_171239_536">
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="#010101" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
</DIV>

<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A09-35889_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	As a result, despite
	decreases in variable expenses, such as salaries and benefits, and purse
	expenses, operating expenses became a larger percentage of total revenues.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Total
	purse expense decreased $1,418,000, or 19.5%, in 2009 compared to 2008 as
	presented in the table below.&#160; As
	discussed in greater detail in Item 1(c)&nbsp;(iv)&nbsp;above, Minnesota law
	requires us to allocate a portion of funds received from betting in the card
	room and wagering on simulcast and live horse races for future payment as
	purses for live horse races or other authorized uses.&#160; While most of these funds are paid into the
	purse funds for thoroughbred, quarter horse and standardbred races, Minnesota
	law requires that a portion of funds allocated for purses be paid into the
	MBF.&#160; A description of how the purse
	expense was derived from these three sources and allocated for purse expense
	and to the MBF is presented below.&#160; The
	decline in card room revenues in 2009 compared to 2008 resulted in the
	decreases in card room purse and MBF expense shown in the table below.&#160; Total purse expense associated with simulcast
	racing decreased in 2009 compared to 2008 is primarily due to lower wagering
	levels, while purse expense associated with live racing decreased primarily due
	to conducting 81 fewer races during 2009, which further resulted in decreased
	on-track handle.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;

</TD>
<TD WIDTH="13%" COLSPAN="2" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:13.84%;">

	&nbsp;

</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:2.88%;">

</FONT>

<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:2.9%;">

<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	1,008,000
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:1.16%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Under
	Minnesota law, the Company is required to pay 10% of the first $6 million of
	gross card room revenues towards purses for live horse racing at the
	Racetrack.&#160; After meeting the $6 million
	threshold, the Company must pay 14% of gross card room revenues as purse
	monies.&#160; Of funds allocated for purses,
	the amounts paid are allocated 90% to the purse funds and 10% to the MBF.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	amounts paid to the purse fund for simulcast racing differ depending upon
	whether the simulcast wagering occurs during the &#147;Racing Season,&#148; a statutorily
	defined 25-week period beginning in early May&nbsp;each year, or outside of the
	Racing Season.&#160; We paid an average of
	5.68% of handle to the purse fund in 2009, compared to 5.61% in 2008.&#160; We pay 5.50% of pari-mutuel simulcast
	commission revenues to the MBF; consequently, lower revenues result in lower
	MBF expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We
	also experienced a reduction in host fees of $241,000, or 13.3%, in 2009
	compared to 2008 due to lower wagering experienced in 2009 compared to 2008.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Salary
	and benefit expenses decreased by $2,930,000, or 14.6%, for the twelve months
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 compared to the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31,
	2008.&#160; The decrease in salaries and
	benefits expense is primarily attributable to savings achieved through a
	reduction-in-force that occurred in October&nbsp;of 2008.&#160; Additionally, the suspension of the bonus
	program, contributions to the Company&#146;s Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP),
	and 401(k)&nbsp;match contributions, as reported in prior filings, have
	continued to provide cost savings.&#160; To
	further contain costs, the Company implemented a wage freeze program in 2009.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Utilities expense
	decreased $329,000, or 23.3%, in 2009 primarily due to efficiencies provided by
	a new building management system and decreased prices for utilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Advertising
	and marketing expenses declined $163,000, or 10.9%, in 2009 primarily due to
	lower advertising agency and related fees resulting from increased use of
	internal resources.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	24
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_PB_24_171815_5926">
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="#010101" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>

<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A09-35889_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of
	Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Net other income
	decreased $72,000, or 67.0%, in 2009 compared to 2008.&#160; This decrease is primarily attributable to a
	$80,000 decrease in interest income on our primary bank account balance during
	2009.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Income tax expense
	as a percentage of pre-tax income increased to 76.6% for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2009 from 46.8% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008.&#160; The increase is primarily attributable to a
	reduced level of income before taxes while non-deductible lobbying expenses in
	2009 remained relatively consistent with 2008.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Net income
	decreased $377,000, or 86.1%, to $61,000 for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2009 compared to $438,000 for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008, reflecting
	substantially reduced revenues which were not fully matched by reduced
	expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<U>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	LIQUIDITY
	AND CAPITAL RESOURCES
</FONT>
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	At December&nbsp;31,
	2009, we had unrestricted cash and cash equivalents of $4.7 million compared to
	$3.7 million at December&nbsp;31, 2008.&#160;
	This $1.0 million increase consists of $1.9 million net cash provided by
	operating activities and $0.4 million net cash provided by financing
	activities, offset by $1.3 million net cash used in investing activities.&#160; In addition, as of December&nbsp;31, 2009, we
	had $3.0 million of capacity under a commercial revolving credit line as part
	of a general credit and security agreement with Bremer Bank that will expire on
	June&nbsp;30, 2010.&#160; The Company plans to
	renew this credit line before it expires.&#160;
	We had no borrowings under the credit line in 2009 or 2008.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Our three largest sources
	of revenue, pari-mutuel wagering, card room operations and concessions, are all
	based on cash transactions.&#160;
	Consequently, we have significant inflows of cash on a daily basis.&#160; We designate cash balances which will be
	required to satisfy certain short-term liabilities such as progressive
	jackpots, the player pool and amounts due horsemen for purses and awards as &#147;restricted&#148;
	as a separate balance sheet item.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company&#146;s table games
	are required by law to be &#147;unbanked&#148;.&#160; &#147;Unbanked&#148;
	refers to a wagering system or game where wagers &#147;lost&#148; or &#147;won&#148; by the host
	are accumulated into a player pool liability for purposes of enhancing the
	total amount paid back to players in any other card game.&#160; The Company may only serve as custodian of
	the player pool.&#160; It may not have an
	active interest in any card game and does not recognize net &#147;wins&#148; or &#147;losses&#148;
	as revenue.&#160; The Company is required to
	return accumulated player pool funds to the players through giveaways,
	promotional items, prizes or by other means.&#160;
	The player pool liability was approximately $156,000 at December&nbsp;31,
	2009 compared to $294,000 at December&nbsp;31, 2008.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The card room offers
	progressive jackpots for poker games.&#160;
	Amounts collected for these jackpot funds are accrued as liabilities
	until paid to winners.&#160; At December&nbsp;31,
	2009, accrued jackpot funds totaled approximately $486,000 compared to $636,000
	at December&nbsp;31, 2008.&#160; The MRC
	regulates the operation of the player pool and progressive jackpot pools.&#160; These liabilities have the potential for
	significant fluctuation on a daily basis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	All games in the card
	room are played using chips.&#160; The value
	of chips issued and outstanding, referred to as the &#147;outstanding chip
	liability,&#148; was approximately $191,000 at December&nbsp;31, 2009, compared to
	$189,000 at December&nbsp;31, 2008.&#160; This
	liability has the potential for significant fluctuation on a daily basis
	depending upon the demand for chip redemptions and sales.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Our
	second largest individual operating expense item is purse expense.&#160; Pursuant to an agreement with the MHBPA, we
	transferred into a trust account or paid directly to the MHBPA approximately
	$5,525,000 and $6,534,000 in purse funds for the years ended December&nbsp;31,
	2009 and 2008, respectively.&#160; Minnesota
	Statutes specify that amounts transferred into trust are the property of the
	trust and not the Company.&#160; Unpaid purse
	fund obligations due the MHBPA were $35,422 and $48,251 at December&nbsp;31,
	2009 and 2008, respectively.&#160; The
	weighted average interest rates on any purses accrued but not transferred into
	the trust were 4.50% on both December&nbsp;31, 2009 and 2008.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	25
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_PB_25_171908_4688">
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="#010101" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage26"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A09-35889_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of
	Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Company believes that unrestricted funds available in its cash accounts,
	amounts available under the general credit and security agreement, along with
	funds generated from operations, will be sufficient to satisfy its liquidity
	and capital resource requirements for regular operations for the foreseeable
	future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	CASH
	FLOWS FROM OPERATING ACTIVITIES
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Net
	cash provided by operations during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 was
	$1,930,905, which resulted primarily from net income of $60,970 and
	depreciation of $2,094,174, offset by a decrease in card room accruals of
	$513,830.&#160; The decrease in card room
	accruals was primarily as a result of there being more days accrued in 2008 for
	the dealer tips.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Net
	cash provided by operations during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008 was
	$1,648,538, which resulted primarily from net income of $438,180, depreciation
	of $2,141,023, and a decrease in restricted cash of $771,340, offset by a
	decrease in accounts payable and accrued wages and payroll taxes of $846,969
	and a decrease in card room accruals of $724,583.&#160; The decrease in restricted cash and card room
	accruals was primarily as a result of an increase in player promotions that
	were offered in 2008.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<H4 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	CASH FLOWS FROM
	INVESTING ACTIVITIES
</FONT>
</I>
</H4>
<H4 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</I>
</H4>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Cash used in investing
	activities for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 of $1,340,178 resulted
	primarily from upgrades to our grandstand for approximately and the purchase of
	equipment for our backside operations.&#160;
	In addition, in 2009, the Company purchased investments of $500,000 that
	will mature at various dates in 2010 and 2011.&#160;
	Regarding the extensive remodeling project to the card room that began
	in January&nbsp;2010, the Company anticipates using cash on hand to fund the
	project and to avoid drawing on its line of credit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Cash used in investing
	activities for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008 of $2,332,048 resulted
	primarily from the purchase of a building management system and upgrades to the
	grandstand building and card room.&#160; In
	addition, in 2008, the Company purchased short-term investments of $200,000
	that will mature at various dates in 2009.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<H6 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	CASH FLOWS FROM FINANCING ACTIVITIES
</FONT>
</I>
</H6>
<H6 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AVOID;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</I>
</H6>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Cash
	provided by financing activities was $404,739 for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2009 compared to cash used in financing activities of $2,621,148 for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2008. The 2009 cash inflow resulted solely from
	proceeds of $404,739 received upon the issuance of common stock due to the
	exercise of stock options and shares of common stock purchased by employees
	pursuant to our Employee Stock Purchase Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Cash
	used in financing activities was $2,621,148 for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2008.&#160; The 2008 net cash outflows
	resulted primarily from a $.25 per share cash dividend totaling $1,007,173 paid
	in July&nbsp;2008.&#160; In addition,
	throughout 2008 and pursuant to a Stock Repurchase Plan approved in January&nbsp;2008,
	the Company repurchased 216,543 shares of common stock at an average price of
	$8.71 per share for a total cost of $1,886,034.&#160;
	These outflows were partially offset by proceeds of $250,324 received
	upon the issuance of common stock due to the exercise of stock options and
	shares of common stock purchased by employees pursuant to our Employee Stock
	Purchase Plan and the related excess tax benefit of $21,735.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<B>
<U>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	OFF-BALANCE SHEET ARRANGEMENTS
</FONT>
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Company currently has no off-balance sheet arrangements and has no intent to
	enter into any such agreements in the near future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<U>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	COMMITMENTS
	AND CONTRACTUAL OBLIGATIONS
</FONT>
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In March&nbsp;2008, the Company entered
	into a six-year totalizator service agreement with Scientific Games Inc.&#160; Pursuant to the agreement, Scientific Games
	provides totalizator equipment and computer programs which record and process
	all wagers and calculate odds and payoffs.&#160;
	In October&nbsp;2008, the Company entered into a
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	four-year
	service agreement to outsource its information technology (IT) function.&#160; Amounts charged to operations under these
	agreements for the years ended December&nbsp;31,
	2009 and 2008 were approximately $644,000 and $377,000, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company has entered into operating leases for rental of office
	equipment, equipment to print certain publications, and track equipment to
	maintain the Racetrack.&#160; Amounts charged
	to operations under these agreements for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2009
	and 2008 were approximately $142,000 and $85,000, respectively.&#160; All such leases expire on or before September&nbsp;30,
	2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Since December&nbsp;31,
	2009, there have been no material changes outside the ordinary course of
	business to our contractual obligations as set forth above.&#160;&#160; As of December&nbsp;31, 2009, we had no
	borrowings pursuant to our line of credit and were not party to capital lease
	obligations, significant purchase obligations or other long-term obligations.
</FONT>
</P>

	FORWARD-LOOKING
	STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	From time to time, in
	reports filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission, in press releases,
	and in other communications to shareholders or the investing public, we may
	make forward-looking statements concerning possible or anticipated future
	financial performance, prospective business activities or plans which are
	typically preceded by words such as &#147;believes,&#148; &#147;expects,&#148; &#147;anticipates,&#148; &#147;intends&#148;
	or similar expressions.&#160; For such
	forward-looking statements, we claim the protection of the safe harbor for
	forward-looking statements contained in federal securities laws.&#160; Shareholders and the investing public should
	understand that such forward-looking statements are subject to risks and
	uncertainties which could affect our actual results and cause actual results to
	differ materially from those indicated in the forward-looking statements.&#160; Such risks and uncertainties include, but are
	not limited to: material fluctuations in attendance at the Racetrack, material
	changes in the level of wagering by patrons, decline in interest in the
	unbanked card games offered at the card room, competition from other venues
	offering unbanked card games, or other forms of wagering, competition from
	other sports and entertainment options, costs associated with our efforts to
	obtain legislative authority for additional gaming options, increases in
	compensation and employee benefit costs, increases in the percentage of
	revenues allocated for purse fund payments, higher than expected expense
	related to new marketing initiatives, the impact of wagering products and
	technologies introduced by competitors, legislative and regulatory decisions
	and changes, the general health of the gaming sector, and other factors that
	are beyond our ability to control or predict.
</FONT>
</P>

<DIV>
<P STYLE="BACKGROUND:WHITE;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

<P STYLE="BACKGROUND:WHITE;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">

<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	REPORT OF
	INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM
</FONT>
</B>
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_REPORTOFINDEPENDENTREGISTEREDPUBL_175256">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Board of Directors and
	Stockholders
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Canterbury Park Holding
	Corporation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We have audited the
	accompanying consolidated balance sheet of Canterbury Park Holding Corporation
	(a Minnesota corporation) as of December&nbsp;31, 2009, and the related
	consolidated statements of operations, stockholders&#146; equity, and cash flows for
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009.&#160;
	These financial statements are the responsibility of the Company&#146;s
	management.&#160; Our responsibility is to
	express an opinion on these financial statements based on our audit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We
	conducted our audit in accordance with the standards of the Public Company
	Accounting Oversight Board (United States).&nbsp; Those standards require that
	we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the
	financial statements are free of material misstatement.&nbsp; The Company is
	not required to have, nor were we engaged to perform, an audit of its internal
	control over financial reporting.&nbsp; Our audit included consideration of
	internal control over financial reporting as a basis for designing audit
	procedures that are appropriate in the circumstances, but not for the purpose
	of expressing an opinion on the effectiveness of the Company&#146;s internal control
	over financial reporting.&nbsp; Accordingly, we express no such opinion.&nbsp;
	An audit also includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the
	amounts and disclosures in the financial statements, assessing the accounting
	principles used and significant estimates made by management, as well as
	evaluating the overall financial statement presentation.&nbsp; We believe that
	our audit provides a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In our
	opinion, the consolidated financial statements referred to above present
	fairly, in all material respects, the financial position of Canterbury Park
	Holding Corporation as of December&nbsp;31, 2009, and the results of their
	operations and their cash flows for the year then ended, in conformity with
	accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Grant Thornton LLP
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;WIDTH:100.0%;">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID WINDOWTEXT 1.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:50.0%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	/s/ Grant Thornton LLP
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:50.0%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER:NONE;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:50.0%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Minneapolis, Minnesota
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:50.0%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;">

</TD>
</TR>

<TD WIDTH="50%" VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:50.0%;">

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION_2"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	REPORT OF
	INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM
</FONT>
</B>
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_REPORTOFINDEPENDENTREGISTEREDPUBL_175306">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	To the Board of Directors
	and Stockholders of
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Canterbury Park Holding
	Corporation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Shakopee, Minnesota
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We have audited the
	accompanying consolidated balance sheet of Canterbury Park Holding Corporation
	and subsidies (the &#147;Company&#148;) as of December&nbsp;31, 2008, and the related
	consolidated statements of operations, stockholders&#146; equity, and cash flows for
	the period ended December&nbsp;31, 2008.&#160;
	These consolidated financial statements are the responsibility of the
	Company&#146;s management.&#160; Our responsibility
	is to express an opinion on the financial statements based on our audit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We
	conducted our audit in accordance with the standards of the Public Company
	Accounting Oversight Board (United States).&nbsp; Those standards require that
	we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the
	financial statements are free of material misstatement.&nbsp; The Company is
	not required to have, nor were we engaged to perform, an audit of its internal
	control over financial reporting.&nbsp; Our audit included consideration of
	internal control over financial reporting as a basis for designing audit
	procedures that are appropriate in the circumstances, but not for the purpose
	of expressing an opinion on the effectiveness of the Company&#146;s internal control
	over financial reporting.&nbsp; Accordingly, we express no such opinion.&nbsp;
	An audit also includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the
	amounts and disclosures in the financial statements, assessing the accounting
	principles used and significant estimates made by management, as well as
	evaluating the overall financial statement presentation.&nbsp; We believe that
	our audit provides a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In our
	opinion, such consolidated financial statements present fairly, in all material
	respects, the financial position of Canterbury Park Holding Corporation and
	subsidies as of December&nbsp;31, 2008, and the results of their operations and
	their cash flows for the period ended December&nbsp;31, 2008, in conformity
	with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:1.3%;">

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="10%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:10.7%;">

</FONT>

</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:1.0%;">

<A NAME="eolPage35"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A09-35889_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	CANTERBURY PARK HOLDING
	CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIARIES
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO
	CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</FONT>
</B>
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_NOTESTOCONSOLIDATEDFINANCIALSTATE_180032">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	YEARS ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2009 AND
	2008
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	1.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Business
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#151; Canterbury Park Holding Corporation
	was incorporated on March&nbsp;24, 1994.&#160;
	On March&nbsp;29, 1994, the Company acquired all the outstanding
	securities of Jacobs Realty,&nbsp;Inc. (JRI) from Irwin Jacobs and IMR Fund,
	L.P. (an investment fund for various pension plans and trusts).&#160; JRI was merged into the Company, and the
	acquisition was accounted for under the purchase method of accounting whereby
	the acquired assets and liabilities have been recorded at the Company&#146;s
	cost.&#160; The primary asset of JRI was
	Canterbury Downs Racetrack and the 325 acres of surrounding land.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On May&nbsp;20,
	1994, the Company adopted a plan of Reorganization pursuant to which the sole
	shareholder of Canterbury Park Concessions,&nbsp;Inc. (CPC), and majority
	shareholder of the Company, agreed to exchange his shares of CPC stock for
	198,888 shares of the Company&#146;s common stock concurrent with the closing of a
	public offering.&#160; Pursuant to the Plan of
	Reorganization, CPC became a wholly owned subsidiary of the Company in August&nbsp;1994
	when the Company completed the initial public offering of its common
	stock.&#160; This reorganization was treated
	in a manner similar to a pooling of interests.&#160;
	Net proceeds received by the Company from the public offering were
	approximately $4,847,000, which along with additional borrowings under the
	Company&#146;s line of credit with the majority shareholder, were used to pay off
	the remaining notes payable from the acquisition of JRI.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The consolidated
	financial statements include the accounts of the Company, CPC and Shakopee
	Valley RV Park Acquisition Company, LLC after elimination of intercompany
	accounts and transactions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Presentation
	&#151;
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Consolidated Statement of Operations, Consolidated Statement of Changes in
	Stockholders&#146; Equity, and Consolidated Statement of Cash Flows from the
	prior-period have been conformed to the 2009 presentation.&nbsp; This
	presentation change and certain reclassifications in the footnotes had no
	effect on net income, earnings per share, or stockholders&#146; equity.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Revenue
	Recognition &#151;
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Our
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	revenues are derived primarily from the operations of
	a card room, pari-mutuel wagering on simulcast and live horse races, concession
	sales, and related activities.&#160;
	Collection revenue from card room operations, a set percentage of
	wagers, is recognized at the time that the wagering process is complete.&#160; Pari-mutuel revenues are recognized upon
	occurrence of the live race that is presented for wagering and after that live
	race is made official by the respective state&#146;s racing regulatory body.&#160; Revenues related to concession and
	publication sales and parking and admission fees are recognized as revenue when
	the service has been performed or the product has been delivered.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Estimates
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#151; The preparation of the consolidated
	financial statements in conformity with accounting principles generally
	accepted in the United States of America requires management to make estimates
	and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and
	disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the consolidated
	financial statements and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during
	the reporting period.&#160; Actual results
	could differ from these estimates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Restricted
	Cash
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#151; Restricted
	cash represents refundable deposits and amounts due to horsemen for purses,
	stakes and awards, and amounts accumulated in card game progressive jackpot
	pools, the Player Pool and Poker Promotional Fund to be used to repay card
	players in the form of promotions, giveaways, prizes, or by other means.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Uncashed
	Winning Tickets &#151;
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Company records a liability for winning tickets upon the completion of a
	race.&#160; As winning tickets are redeemed,
	this liability is reduced for the respective cash payment.&#160;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	35
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_PB_35_152005_7056">
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="#010101" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='35',FILE='C:\JMS\MSOUNDA\09-35889-1\TASK4021382\35889-1-BK.HTM',USER='105074',CD='MAR 30 21:23 2010' -->
<A NAME="eolPage36"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A09-35889_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of
	Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We recognize
	revenue associated with the uncashed winning tickets when the likelihood of the
	redemption of the winning ticket is remote.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="BACKGROUND:WHITE;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Promotional Allowances &#151;
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company
	offers certain promotional allowances at no charge to patrons who participate
	in our player rewards program.&#160; The
	retail value of these promotional items is shown as a deduction from total
	revenues on the Company&#146;s consolidated statements of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="BACKGROUND:WHITE;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Due to
	Minnesota Horsemen&#146;s Benevolent and Protective Association,&nbsp;Inc. (&#147;MHBPA&#148;)
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#151; The Minnesota Pari-Mutuel Horse Racing
	Act specifies that the Company is required to segregate a portion of funds
	(recorded as purse expense in the statements of operations), received from card
	room operations and wagering on simulcast and live horse races, for future
	payment as purses for live horse races or other uses of the horsepersons&#146;
	associations.&#160; Pursuant to an agreement
	with the MHBPA, the Company has transferred into a trust account or paid
	directly to the MHBPA, approximately $5,525,000 and $6,534,000 for the years
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 and 2008, respectively, related to thoroughbred
	races.&#160; Minnesota Statutes specify that
	amounts transferred into the trust account are the property of the trust and
	not of the Company.&#160; The interest rate on
	any purses accrued but not transferred into the trust was 4.50% on both December&nbsp;31,
	2009 and December&nbsp;31, 2008.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Impairment
	of Long-Lived Assets &#151;
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Management of the Company periodically reviews the carrying value of
	property and equipment for potential impairment by comparing the carrying value
	of these assets with their related expected future net cash flows.&#160; Should the sum of the related expected future
	net cash flows be less than the carrying value, management will determine
	whether an impairment loss should be recognized.&#160; An impairment loss would be measured by the
	amount by which the carrying value of the asset exceeds the fair value of the
	asset.&#160; To date, management has
	determined that no impairment of these assets exists.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Land,
	Buildings, and Equipment
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#151; Land, buildings, equipment, and building improvements are
	capitalized at a level of $1,000 or greater and are recorded at cost.&#160; Repair and maintenance costs are charged to
	operations when incurred.&#160; Furniture,
	fixtures, and equipment are depreciated using the straight-line method over
	estimated useful lives ranging from 5 &#151; 7 years, while buildings are
	depreciated over 15 &#151; 39 years.&#160; Building
	improvements are amortized using the straight-line method over the useful life
	of the assets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<H1 STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AUTO;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Card
	Room&nbsp;Accruals &#151;
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;">
	Minnesota law allows
	the Company to collect amounts from patrons to fund progressive jackpot pools
	in the card room.&#160; These amounts, along
	with amounts earned by the player pool, promotional pools and the outstanding
	chip liability, are accrued as short-term liabilities at each balance sheet
	date.
</FONT>
</H1>
<H1 STYLE="FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:NORMAL;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:AUTO;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</I>
</H1>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Income
	Taxes
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#151; Income
	taxes are accounted for under the asset and liability method.&#160; Deferred tax assets and liabilities are
	recognized for the estimated future tax consequences attributable to
	differences between the financial statement carrying amounts of existing assets
	and liabilities and their respective tax bases.&#160;
	Deferred tax assets and liabilities are measured using enacted tax rates
	in effect for the year in which those temporary differences are expected to
	reverse.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We have adopted the
	provisions of ASC 740,
<I>
	Income Taxes
</I>
	(&#147;ASC
	740&#148;).&#160; ASC 740 clarifies the accounting
	for uncertainty in income taxes recognized in an enterprise&#146;s financial
	statements and also prescribes a recognition threshold and measurement
	attribute for the financial statement recognition and measurement of a tax
	position taken or expected to be taken in a tax return. Additionally, ASC 740
	provides guidance on derecognition, classification, interest and penalties,
	accounting in interim periods, disclosure and transition.&#160; The adoption of ASC 740 had no effect on the
	amounts previously recognized for income taxes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Interest
	and penalties associated with uncertain income tax positions are presented in
	income tax expense.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	During the twelve months
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, we have not recognized expense for
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	36
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_PB_36_152039_5335">
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="#010101" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='36',FILE='C:\JMS\MSOUNDA\09-35889-1\TASK4021382\35889-1-BK.HTM',USER='105074',CD='MAR 30 21:23 2010' -->
<A NAME="eolPage37"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A09-35889_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	interest and penalties
	and do not have any amounts accrued at December&nbsp;31, 2009 and December&nbsp;31,
	2008 respectively, for the payment of interest and penalties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Net
	Income Per Share
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#151;
	Basic net income per common share is based on the weighted average number of
	common shares outstanding during each year.&#160;
	Diluted net income per common share takes into effect the dilutive
	effect of potential common shares outstanding.&#160;
	The Company&#146;s only potential common shares outstanding are stock options
	and shares of unvested restricted stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Fair
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<I>
	Values
	of Financial Instruments
</I>
	&#151; Due to the current classification of all
	financial instruments of the Company and given the short-term nature of the
	related account balances, carrying amounts reported in the consolidated balance
	sheets approximate fair value.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Recent
	Accounting Pronouncements &#151;
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In June&nbsp;2009, the Financial
	Accounting Standards Board, (&#147;FASB&#148;) issued Accounting Standards Codification (&#147;ASC&#148;)
	105,
<I>
	Generally Accepted Accounting
	Principles
</I>
	(&#147;ASC 105&#148;).&nbsp;&nbsp;ASC 105 establishes the FASB
	Accounting Standards Codification (&#147;Codification&#148;) as the source of
	authoritative accounting principles recognized by the FASB to be applied by
	nongovernment entities in the preparation of financial statements in conformity
	with GAAP.&nbsp;&nbsp;Rules&nbsp;and interpretive releases of the SEC under
	authority of federal securities law are also sources of authoritative GAAP for
	SEC registrants.&nbsp; References to FASB guidance throughout this document
	have been updated for the Codification.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company adopted an
	update to ASC 805 &#151;
<I>
	Business Combinations
</I>
	(&#147;ASC
	805&#148;)&nbsp;on January&nbsp;1, 2009.&nbsp;&nbsp;ASC 805 establishes principles
	and requirements for how the acquirer of a business recognizes and measures in
	its financial statements the identifiable assets acquired, the liabilities
	assumed, and any noncontrolling interest in the acquiree.&#160; The statement also provides guidance for
	recognizing and measuring the goodwill acquired in the business combination and
	determines what information to disclose to enable users of the financial
	statements to evaluate the nature and financial effects of the business
	combination. This update had no material impact on the Company&#146;s financial
	position, results of operations or cash flows.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company
	adopted an update to&nbsp;ASC 820 &#151;
<I>
	Fair Value Measurement and
	Disclosures
</I>
	&nbsp;(&#147;ASC 820&#148;) January&nbsp;1, 2009 for non-financial
	assets.&nbsp;&nbsp;ASC 820 defines fair value, establishes a framework for
	measuring fair value, and expands disclosures about fair value
	measurement.&nbsp;&nbsp;ASC 820 also emphasizes that fair value is a
	market-based measurement, not an entity-specific measurement, and sets out a
	fair value hierarchy with the highest priority being quoted prices in active
	markets.&nbsp;&nbsp;Under ASC 820, fair value measurements are disclosed by
	level within that hierarchy.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company adopted ASC 820 for the
	fiscal year beginning January&nbsp;1, 2008 for financial assets.&#160; The adoption of ASC 820&nbsp;and the update
	had no material impact on the Company&#146;s financial position, results of
	operations, or cash flows.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company
	adopted an update to ASC 855 &#151;
<I>
	Subsequent Events
</I>
	(&#147;ASC 855&#148;) on April&nbsp;1, 2009.&nbsp;&nbsp;ASC 855 provides guidance on when
	a subsequent event should be recognized in the financial statements. Subsequent
	events that provide additional evidence about conditions that existed at the
	date of the balance sheet should be recognized at the balance sheet date.&#160; Subsequent events that provide evidence about
	conditions that arose after the balance sheet date but before financial
	statements are issued, or are available to be issued, are not required to be
	recognized.&#160; The date through which
	subsequent events have been evaluated must be disclosed as well as whether it
	is the date the financial statements were issued or the date the financial
	statements were available to be issued.&#160;
	For non-recognized subsequent events which should be disclosed to keep
	the financial statements from being misleading, the nature of the event and an
	estimate of its financial effect, or a statement that such an estimate cannot
	be made, should be disclosed. The standard is effective for interim or annual
	periods ending after June&nbsp;15, 2009.&#160;
	The adoption of ASC 855 and the update had no material impact on the
	Company&#146;s financial position, results of operations, or cash flows.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	37
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_PB_37_152057_5796">
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="#010101" ALIGN="LEFT">

<A NAME="eolPage38"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A09-35889_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of
	Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Stock
	Based Employee Compensation
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#151; ASC 718, Compensation &#151; Stock Compensation (&#147;ASC
	718&#148;), requires recognition of employee services provided in exchange for a
	share-based payment based on the grant date fair market value.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	ASC 718 requires the use of a fair value based measurement method when
	granting stock options.&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company selected the Black-Scholes
	method to measure the compensation cost for stock options.&#160; The Black-Scholes method requires the use of
	significant assumptions to estimate the fair value of the stock option awards.&#160; The expected term of both the board of
	director and key employee options was calculated using the simplified
	method.&#160; The expected volatility was
	calculated primarily with reliance on historical volatility rates.&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Company assumed a dividend yield equivalent to historical dividend rates over
	the vesting period.&#160; The risk-free rate
	utilized in the Black-Scholes calculations was the U.S. Constant Maturity
	Treasury Security for the period equivalent to the term of the option.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The fair value of
	options granted under the 1994 Stock Plan during 2009 and 2008 was estimated on
	the date of grant using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model with the
	following weighted average assumptions and results:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<TD WIDTH="12%" COLSPAN="2" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:12.84%;">

</FONT>

</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:3.0%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	%
</FONT>

<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:2.88%;">

</TD>
<TD WIDTH="12%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE WINDOWTEXT 2.25PT;BORDER-LEFT:NONE;BORDER-RIGHT:NONE;BORDER-TOP:SOLID WINDOWTEXT 1.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:12.52%;">
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">

</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	3.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	FAIR VALUE
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	ASC 820 defines
	fair value as the exchange price that would be received for an asset or paid to
	transfer a liability (an exit price) in the principal or most advantageous
	market for the asset or liability in an orderly transaction between market
	participants on the measurement date.&#160;
	ASC 820 also establishes a fair value hierarchy which requires an entity
	to maximize the use of observable inputs and minimize the use of unobservable
	inputs when measuring fair value.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	38
<A NAME="A09-35889_110K_HTM_PB_38_152243_2897">
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR="#010101" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='38',FILE='C:\JMS\MSOUNDA\09-35889-1\TASK4021382\35889-1-BK.HTM',USER='105074',CD='MAR 30 21:23 2010' -->
<A NAME="eolPage39"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<A HREF="#A09-35889_110K_HTM_TABLEOFCONTENTS" TITLE="CLICK TO GO TO TABLE OF CONTENTS">
	Table of
	Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The standard
	describes three levels of inputs that may be used to measure fair value:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Level
	1
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#151; Quoted prices
	in active markets for identical assets or liabilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Level
	2
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#151; Observable
	inputs other than Level 1 prices such as quoted prices for similar assets or
	liabilities; quoted prices in markets that are not active; or other inputs that
	are observable or can be corroborated by observable market data for
	substantially the full term of the assets or liabilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Level
	3
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#151; Unobservable
	inputs that are supported by little or no market activity and that are
	significant to the fair value of the assets or liabilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company utilizes the
	market approach to measure fair value for its financial assets and
	liabilities.&nbsp;&nbsp;The market approach uses prices and other relevant
	information generated by market transactions involving identical or comparable
	assets or liabilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Assets and liabilities
	measured at fair value on a recurring basis for December&nbsp;31, 2009 and December&nbsp;31,
	2008 are summarized below:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="45%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" STYLE="BACKGROUND:#CCEEFF;PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:45.36%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT 10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Short-term
	investments (Certificates of Deposit)
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	4.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; INCOME TAXES
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	A reconciliation
	between income taxes computed at the statutory federal income tax rate and the
	effective tax rate is as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

</FONT>
</B>
